loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tools

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 55 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos menores Jorge de 21 y Miguel de 23 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, María ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, maíz y habas, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar, además comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
55 year-old María is a very cheerful and sincere woman.  She lives in her own home together with her two beloved children: 21 year-old Jorge and 23 year-old Miguel, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Through her hard work, María has managed to ensure that her farm provides her with the produce she needs to support her family.  Before the sun is up, she leaves home and walks for almost an hour to reach her farmland where she grows potatoes, corn and beans, products which she later takes to sell in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What María most enjoys about her work is cultivating her land since she feels that she is putting it to good use.  María has been in this business for 36 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her produce to Tarma since the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out.  Over time, María would like to set up a grocery store which would help her to improve her finances.

This is María's ninth loan through MFP.  She is very happy to be able to access this loan and she would like to thank all the people who will make it possible for her to obtain the money that she needs.  María is a very well-respected member of her community bank because of the order that she brings to their meetings.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy new seeds to sow.  She will also buy manure and insecticides.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria nació en la ciudad de Anta del departamento del Cusco y tiene 48 años de edad. Actualmente, Gregoria vive junto con sus dos hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia, ella por las mañanas se dedica a la limpieza de casas y que por las tardes se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller básicamente implementada que funciona en su domicilio. Ya son 8 años que se dedica este negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.

Gregoria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comrpar materiales como cuero, lana, hilos  y otras cosa que necesita para confeccionar sus productos. 

Gregoria es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 48 years old and was born in the city of Anta in the Department of Cusco. She currently lives with her two children in Cusco, which is known as the Imperial City of the Incas. Gregoria is a responsible mother who wants to move her family forward. She cleans houses in the mornings and then spends the afternoons making handicrafts. Gregoria has a small workshop that she operates out of her home. She has been in this business for eight years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work.

Gregoria is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy materials such as leather, wool, thread, and other supplies needed to manufacture her products.

She is a responsible member of the Communal Bank “Sumac Purisisun”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To purchase leather, wool, thread, and other supplies for making crafts.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: La Sra. Susy esta renovando su crédito individual  en su primera secuencia trabajó pagando puntualmente, ella vende comida (almuerzo y desayunos)en un kiosco que queda cerca de su casa  y  donde se ubica una parada de minibús, le va  bien ahora esta solicitando para la compra de abarrotes por mayor, arroz, papa, fideo, azúcar y otros, ella tiene 3 niños en edad escolar, su esposo por motivo de trabajo aun esta en Argentina y le envía para la alimentación de la familia, es una persona responsable y trabajadora, que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Susy is renewing her individual loan.  During her first loan cycle she repaid her loan punctually.  Susy sells meals (lunches and breakfasts) from a kiosk which is located near her home, at a minibus stop.  Her business is doing well and she is requesting this loan to buy groceries wholesale: rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar and other products.

Susy has three school-age children.  Her husband is currently in Argentina for work reasons and he sends money home to cover their family's food expenses.  Susy is a responsible and hard-working person who is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale: rice, potatoes, noodles, sugar and other products

loans.name: Jenny Lissette

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2 años y seis meses. El marido es comerciante. Ella nació en Salinas pero hace 5 años se vino a vivir a esta linda ciudad y en ella formo su familia.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para el negocio de él, el cual se dedica  a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y nos cuenta que le realizan muchos pedidos sus clientes y también va a vender a otras ciudades. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 15h00, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos puede ayudar a su esposo y sentirse útil para el bien de su familia.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dios Con Nosotros [God is With Us] meets every two weeks in the Florón residential community in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí Province known as the City in the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.

Here we meet Jenny, who is 22 and has a common-law marriage from which she has one son who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband runs a small business. She was born in Salinas, but 5 years ago she came to live in this lovely city and settled down to raise a family. She is a great housewife who wants to help her husband and is getting the loan for his business. 

He sells all types of clothes, door-to-door, and Jenny tells us that his customers place many orders with him, and that he also goes to other cities to sell. He works every day from 8 am until 3 pm. He sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks. He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil. 

This loan he's going to use to purchase more merchandise, including pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. Jenny has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because she can help her husband through the loans and feel useful for the good of her family.  Her dream is to someday have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 47 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Ronald de 28 años y lo que más desea es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Yolanda tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas, choclo y habas, productos que posteriormente llevara a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, teme que los químicos sea dañino para su salud. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 47, is a very pleasant and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her beloved son Ronald, 28. What she wants most is to give him a better quality of life. The arduous days of work Yolanda has invested in her farm have improved her crops and made her lands more productive. She starts work very early in the morning, growing potatoes, corn and broad beans, which she later will sell in the largest market in the city of Tarma. 

What she likes most about her work is planting her fields and seeing how her crops grow. She has done this for 10 years and says the most difficult thing is fumigating her lands, as she is afraid the chemicals might be bad for her health. In time she hopes to buy more lands and increase her production. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays it on time, she will be able to get another with greater ease and without making things complicated for her communal bank, where she is well-loved by the rest of the members. With the requested two thousand soles, she will buy manure for her farmlands.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her fields

loans.name: Benito Jacinto

texts.es: Benito Jacinto tiene 39 años, su actividad económica es el taller de carpintería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos él se siente muy motivado por continuar trabajando pues es por medio de los financiamientos que ha podido mantener activo su negocio. el trabaja con ciertas herramientas rusticas, sus 3 hijos menores que son los que están a su cargo le ayudan en lo que pueden en su actividad, por lo que esto hace que Benito se sienta muy orgulloso. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de clavos, pega, maque, madera y herramientas. Siempre sueña con ampliar su pequeño taller y proporcionarle a su familia una mejor comodidad.
texts.en: Benito Jacinto is 39 and has a carpentry workshop. He has had this business for more than 4 years. This is not the first time he has gotten a loan, and he feels very motivated to continue working since this financing has allowed him to keep his business running. He works with certain rustic tools, and his three minor children, who are in his care, help him however they can, which makes Benito very proud. The financing is for working capital, to purchase nails, glue, lacquer, wood, and tools. He always dreams about expanding his small workshop and making it more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to purchase nails, glue, lacquer, wood, and tools

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es: Mardonia, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro, para forjarse un buen futuro. Trabajando arduamente Mardonia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su siembra de papa, arvejas y maíz, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra sembrando y cosechando sola. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se vende. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por ello que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de papa y arvejas, para cosechar en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Mardonia is 38 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home.  What she most desires is to work very hard in order to shape a good future for herself.

Through her hard work, Mardonia has managed to make progress with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early in order to irrigate and tend to her potato, pea and corn crops which she later sells in the city of Tarma since that is where she obtains the best prices for her products.

What Mardonia most enjoys about her work is that she can enjoy the freedom of working on her land.  She has been in this business for 36 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be working her land, sowing and harvesting on her own.  Over time, Mardonia hopes to be able to prepare her land in order to grow peas since this is the crop that is selling best right now.

This is Mardonia's tenth loan through MFP and she knows that the loan will help her a lot in making progress in her business.  For this reason, she is prepared to make all her repayments on time.  Mardonia is a very responsible member of her community bank which means that she is very well liked.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles that she has requested to buy more potato and pea seeds which she will harvest this season.

loans.use: to buy pea and potato seeds

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy tiene 45 años,  su actividad es la venta de cerdos. Es una persona responsable que disfruta cada momento de su trabajo. Inicio este medio de vida hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. Todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para recorrer diferentes comarcas, en donde obtiene muy buenos cerdos pues tiene bastante conocimiento en su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra alimentos para cerdos y para la compra de dos cerdos grandes.
texts.en: Eddy is a 45-year-old man who sells hogs for a living. He is a responsible person who enjoys every minute of his job. He started this business over 12 years ago, and he is always attentive to the demands of his customers. Every day, he has to wake up early in order to visit the different regions in which he purchases good quality pigs, as he is very knowledgeable in his field. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase pig feed and two large hogs.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and two large hogs.

loans.name: Luzcetty Moserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Luzcetty, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 10 y 2 años, está en su sexto mes de embarazo de su tercer hijo, la mayor estudia en la escuela. El marido es comerciante, vende frutas y legumbres en el mercado de la ciudad.

Es una joven ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana en sus ventas ya que el resto de días trabaja en un restaurante en la cual le pagan un sueldo, sus productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lo que más vende son los perfumes y las cremas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, frutas y legumbres para el negocio del marido. Este es el cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
The Dios Con Nosotros (God With Us) Community Bank gets together every 15 days in the Florón residential complex of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabi province which is known as the City of the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.

Here is where we met Ms. Luzcetty, who is 22 years old and has a live-in partner and two daughters, ages 10 and 2. She is in her sixth month of pregnancy with her third child. Her eldest attends elementary school. Her husband is an entrepreneur who sells fruits and vegetables at the city market.

In order to obtain her own funds, this young homemaker sells Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and accessories for women). She sells these products only three days a week because she works in a restaurant the rest of the week. She accepts credit from her customers and bills them weekly. What she sells most are fragrances and lotions.

This loan is for purchasing fragrances, lotions, and cosmetics, as well as fruits and vegetables for her husband's business. This is her fourth loan cycle in the bank, and she likes it because it is so easy to make payments.

Her dream is to open up her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, D. 64 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija menor Leslie D. 15 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña Catalina aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, col, brócoli, olluco, papa y habas, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 49 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plaga D. insectos que pueden afectar a sus plantaciones. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Catalina, 64 years old, is a woman who has always fought to survive in life. She lives in her own home with her cherished youngest daughter, Leslie, who is 15. She wants to be able to give her a better quality of life.  

At a very young age Catalina learned to work in the field with her parents, who taught her everything she had to do to get a good harvest. Now she has her own land, which she cultivates and cares for with a lot of love and patience. She plants peas, cabbage, broccoli, ulluco [a tuber], potatoes and broad beans, which she takes to the wholesale market in Tarma to sell. What she likes most about her work is planting the crops, since she feels that her hard labor bears fruit. 

She has been doing this for 49 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting the crops from the insect plagues that can affect her plantations. She wants to buy new land, so that she can increase her production. This is her 10th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make her payments punctually and is ready to do so. With the 1,009 nuevo soles that she has requested, she will buy manure for her land, so that the new plantings will bear good fruit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan Manuel Carrizales le está haciendo falta pintar y los detalles de los acabados. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder compra el material que necesita ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Don Juan Manuel pagara el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una compañía de exportación, ya que su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene, de su trabajo como empleada de una casa particular en limpieza. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan un lugar seguro y más cómodo para ellos ya que actual mente están estudiando.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Juan Manuel Carrizales is lacking paint and detailed finishes. He is requesting a loan to buy the necessary materials so that he can complete these improvements during his time off from work.

Don Juan Manuel will repay the loan using the salary he receives from his job at an export company. His wife takes care of the family expenses with her income working as a housekeeper for a private household. Juan Manuel and his wife want their children to have a safe and comfortable place where they can focus on their studies.

loans.use: To finish the interior and exterior of his house.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorrro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro se dedica a ofrecer productos de medicinas naturales.  Tiene más de 6 años en su negocio, por lo que sus inicios se dan porque Mercedes necesitaba un medio de ingreso para su hogar y mantener a sus dos hijos. Ella tiene la responsabilidad de trabajar todos los días pues sabe que tiene que llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.  Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el tiempo, por lo que tiene que dejar todas las cosas elaboradas en su hogar y salir a vender sus productos. Este crédito que  solicita es para la compra de suplementos, polvos, pastillas, vitaminas, hierbas entre otros productos omnilife.
texts.en: Mercedes del Socorrow sells natural medicinal products and has been in business for over 6 years. Mercedes got her start because she needed a source of income to support her two children. She has the responsibility of working every day, as she knows she needs to provide her family with their daily bread. One of her greatest challenges is time because she has to stop her household chores in order to go out and sell her products. The loan that she is requesting is for purchasing supplements, powders, pills, vitamins, herbs, and other Omnilife products.

loans.use: to purchase supplements, powders, pills, vitamins, herbs, and other Omnilife products

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia Del Carmen tiene 52 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que necesitaba un medio de vida para mantener a sus 6 hijos, inicio por medio de una amiga que le dio la idea de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda, fue así que decide obtener esta fuente de ingresos. Su deseo es que su hija finalice sus estudios, para que sea una gran profesional. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, pan, jugos y gaseosas.
texts.en: Lucia Del Carmen is a 52-year-old woman who owns a general store. She has been in business for over 8 years, getting her start because she needed a way to support her 6 children. Her friend gave her the idea of setting up a general store in her home, which was how she decided on this source of income. She would like for her daughter to finish her studies so that she can become a professional. The loan that she is requesting is for purchasing beans, sugar, cooking oil, candy, bread, juice, and soda pop.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, cooking oil, candy, bread, juice, and soft drinks

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 32 años, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Raúl, de 37 años y sus hijos menores. Por quienes trabaja arduamente. Desde su infancia estaba ligado a la crianza de cerdos, actividad que le enseñaron sus padres y que ahora lo realiza como un negocio personal. Ella considera que esta actividad le es bastante rentable, sobre todo cuando son cerdos de raza los que tiene que comercializar, ya que requiere de mayor cuidado y alimentación. Ante esto se ha propuesto comprarse material para elaborar  corrales y separar machos y hembras con crías. En adelante, cuando tenga más capital podrá construir un corral a base de cemento. De este modo, quiere lograr intensificarse en la crianza de cerdos, procurar que sea más higiénica. Su mayor propósito es ganar más para así poder cubrir la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, ya que piensa acceder a posteriores ayudas, para crecer son su labor. De obtener el crédito que necesita, comprará materiales para hacer el corral de cerdos, así como alimentos balanceados para el desarrollo de cerdos.
texts.en: Trinidad is 32 years old and lives in her parents' house with her husband Raul, age 37, and their young children, for whom she works so arduously. Ever since childhood, she has had ties to pig breeding, which she learned from her parents. She is now in the business for herself. She thinks that this business is lucrative, especially when she sells pedigree pigs because they require more care and nutrition. She has decided to purchase materials to build pigpens and separate the boars from the sows and their piglets. Later on, when she has more capital, she will be able to build a cement pigpen, this way she can expand her pig breeding business in a more hygienic manner. Her biggest goal is to earn more money so that she can cover her children's educational expenses until they become professionals. This is her first loan from MFP, and she commits to making her payments punctually since she is planning on obtaining subsequent loans so that her business can grow. Once she obtains the loan she needs, she will purchase materials to make pigpens and feed that is balanced for her pigs' development.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and materials to make pigpens.

loans.name: Karla Sujey

texts.es: La señora Karla tiene 35 años es madre de  2 hijos menores de edad que están a su cargo. Ella se dedica a una pulpería en su casa de habitación, Allí vende desde granos básicos hasta golosinas para llamar la atención de los clientes que habitan cerca. Esta no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos para su negocio. Ella ya tiene 11 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó vendiendo solamente golosinas, pero con el tiempo y la experiencia ha podido ir prosperando para tener un negocio más grande. Este crédito será invertido en la compra de granos básicos tal como arroz, fríjol, azúcar y aceite principalmente. Su sueño es llegar a ver su negocio con más productos, más surtido con productos que demanda la población, para brindar más facilidades económicas a sus hijos y que puedan prepararse en la universidad.
texts.en: Ms. Karla is a 35-year-old mother with 2 young children under her care. She runs a general store from home for a living. There, she sells anything from staple grains to candy in order to attract customers who live nearby. This is not the first time she obtains loans for her business. She has been in business for 11 years. She started out selling only candy, but in time and with experience, she has been able to prosper and have a larger business. This loan will be invested mainly in purchasing sugar, cooking oil and beans, as well as staple grains like rice. Her dream is to see her business stocked with a greater variety of products that meet the demands of the locals, so that she can provide financial stability to her children and help them prepare for college.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, cooking oil, and beans, as well as staple grains like rice

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: Gina tiene 28 años, es una noble mujer. Vive en una casa alquilada, junto a su esposo Christian de 36 años y sus 2 hijos pequeños. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora joven, recorre las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo a sus familiares y demás amistades productos de belleza, negocio que le va bien, ya que tiene buena aceptación en su barrio. Lo que más le gusta de este negocio, son los premios que se gana después de cada pedido que realiza por ello trata de vender siempre mucho mas ganar algún incentivo. En esta oportunidad por campaña escolar sus clientas le han pedido  maletas escolares, por ello le urge comprar, para poder atender el pedido pendiente que tiene. Su fin es de ampliar su negocio y convertirse en una gran comerciante. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cotas de manera puntual, como lo hacia en todo este tiempo. De obtener el crédito que solicita comprará maletas escolares, para atender los pedidos pendiente que tiene.
texts.en: Gina is a 28-year-old dignified woman. She lives in a rented home with her husband, Christian, age 36, and their 2 young children. For 4 years, this young entrepreneur travels the streets of her district selling beauty products to her friends and family. Her business is prosperous since she is well-received in her neighborhood. What she likes the most about this business are the prizes she wins after each order, which is why she always tries to sell a lot more so that she can earn an incentive. At this time, because it is the school season, her customers are requesting book bags, which is why it is essential for her to buy them so that she can fill those orders. Her aim is to expand her business and transform herself into a more prominent entrepreneur. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she commits to making all of her repayments punctually, as she has been doing this whole time. Upon receiving this loan, she will purchase book bags to fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to purchase book bags

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Roger Antonio tiene 34 años, es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo. Su actividad es brindar el servicio de costura, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, desde joven él se dedicaba a un taller y le pagaban por producción, pero como no ganaba suficiente para sufragar los gastos decide establecer su propio negocio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, tijeras, aceite, herramientas ya que actualmente tiene pedidos de faldas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes y camisas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio y mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en: Roger Antonio is a 34-year-old man who is very responsible and enjoys his job. He has been providing sewing services for a living for over 10 years. Ever since he was young, he worked in a factory where he received output-based pay. However, because he did not earn enough to cover his costs, he decided to set up his own business. This loan will be used to purchase fabric, thread, needles, scissors, sewing machine oil, and tools because people have ordered skirts, pants, dresses, suits, and shirts. He dreams of expanding his business and improving the quality of his products.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, scissors, sewing machine oil, and tools.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual significa novia del del sol, la cual es una region ganadera. Doña consuelo tiene la edad de 48 años, estudio solo la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor JUventino el cual tiene un taller de soldador, ella tiene dos hijas las cuales ya estan casadas y actual mente vie solo con su esposo.

Doña Consuelo nos platica que hace mas de 20 años tuvo la inquietud de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar asi que inicia a vender antojitos mexicanos (tostadas,chiles rellenos, tacos, empanadas, garnachas, platanos fritos y papas) los fines de semana(sabado, domingo y lunes) en el patio de su casa.

ella nos dijo"creo que tengo buen sazon porque ya tengo 20 años de vender y algunos me dicen que cosino rico "

Ella necesita este credito para inertirlo en la compra de insumos (col, tomates, chiles, cebolla, frijol, carne, crema, queso, tortillas, maiz, huevos, platanos, papas, aceite y gas) para posteriormente elaborar sus alimentos y venderlos.

ella espera con sus ganancias iniciar la construccion de un pequeño local en el cual piensa intalar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Consuelo lives in a place called Tierra Blanca, which means bride of the sun, a ranching area. Ms. Consuelo is 48 years old, only attended elementary school, and is married to Mr. Juventino, who owns a welding shop. She has two daughters who are already married, so she currently lives alone with her husband.

Ms. Consuelo tells us that twenty years ago, she felt compelled to help her husband with the household expenses, so she started to sell Mexican dishes like tostadas (crispy fried tortillas layered with beans and other ingredients) stuffed chili peppers, tacos, empanadas (stuffed pastry), garnachas (thick cornmeal cakes topped with a variety of ingredients), fried plantains, and potatoes on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays in her patio.

She states, "I think I have knack for cooking because I've been in business for 20 years and some people say that I cook well."

She needs this loan to invest in purchasing ingredients and supplies (cabbage, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, beans, meats, cream, cheese, tortillas, corn, eggs, plantains, potatoes, cooking oil, and propane) so that she can prepare and sell her dishes.

With her profits, she hopes to be able to start building a small office space where she can set up her business.

loans.use: to prepare and sell Mexican comfort food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients for the production of her refreshments

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo T. tiene 27 años de edad, está casado con la señora Linet Calizaya, tienen una hija pequeña a la cual cuidan con mucho cariño y dedicación, ellos viven en el barrio de Esmeralda sud que se encuentra cerca de la  localidad de Sacaba del departamento de Cochabamba. Ricardo es albañil de profesión, él trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y debido a las circunstancias de su trabajo sufre un gran desgaste físico pero ello no le impide que colabore a su querida esposa en las obligaciones del hogar. 

Ricardo quiere el préstamo para que compre una cocina grande con la cual su esposa pueda preparar hamburguesas y luego venderlas por las tardes y noches aprovechando que cerca de su casa hay un colegio el cual es un mercado seguro. Ricardo está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con mejores medios de producción para que pueda incrementar los ingresos familiares y así consiga un mejor estilo de vida.

Ricardo entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que pueda comprar un vehículo para toda su  familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo T. is 27-year-old man who is married to Linet Calizaya. They have a young daughter, whom they look after with much affection and dedication. They live in the Esmeralda Sud neighborhood, located near the Sacaba locality in the department of Cochabamba. Ricardo works as a bricklayer, working every day from the early hours of the morning. Because of his work conditions, he is physically worn out, but this does not prevent him from collaborating with his beloved wife with the housework.

Ricardo wants this loan to purchase a big stove for his wife so that she can make hamburgers and sell them in the afternoon and evening, taking advantage of the fact that they live close to a school--a definite market. Ricardo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, who can give him the opportunity to obtain better means of production so that he can increase the family income, thus obtaining a better lifestyle.

Ricardo plans to obtain a new loan in the future so that he can purchase a vehicle for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a stove and start food business.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 58 years old, single and has an adult son. He lives with his elderly mother in the district of Pacora, a rural area, and has recently acquired access to electricity and drinking water. His community is small with approximately 200 families. Eduardo earns a living providing show repair services. His business is situated within his house. He has more than 20 years of experience in this trade, which he learned from his father, meaning he knows it perfectly. He is very well-known in the area and has an established clientele. He has continued to invest in his business, which has shown continual growth over the years. 

Eduardo has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to invest in the purchase of materials and equipment that he uses to repair shoes. He would also like to use a part of his credit to make some repairs to the floors, walls and door in the part of his house where he attends to clients. With this investment, he can provide a more professional service to his customers. Eduardo has very good personal and work references. He is a hard-worker and responsible. He has managed other loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has paid punctually. His greatest wish is to continue earning a respectable income so that he can continue caring for his elderly mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials for use in his shoe repair business

loans.name: Edy Magally

texts.en:
Edy is 20 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and in-laws in the village of Tranca Fanupe outsiD. of the district of Morrope. Her community is small and rural with about 200 families. The area recently acquired access to electricity and running water. 

Edy earns a living by operating a business based in her home selling men’s and women’s clothing. She established this business about a year ago and has already built an impressive customer base. She has very little competition in the area due to the small size of her community and the distance from commercial shopping areas. She would like to increase her inventory with the purchase of school uniforms and sports clothing. This way, she will be able to respond to the demand of her clients for school clothing now that the new school year has started in Peru. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support in her efforts to grow her business.

loans.use: to add school uniforms to the inventory of clothing she sells

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Gabriel se encuentra localizado en L. comunidad D. Amacuitlapilco, Jonacatepec. Está conformado por 10 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes son L. señora Adelina va a comprar cosméticos por mayoreo para vender, L. señora Adelfina va a comprar D. todo tipo D. dulces, L. señora Salustia va a comprar verduras D. temporada para vender, L. señora Minerva va a comprar marranos para criarlos y venderlos, las señoras Maura y María van a comprar alimento para criar sus animales y venderlos, L. señora Blanca va a comprar vasos, gelatinas, para prepararlas y venderlas, L. señora Salustia va a comprar pan por mayoreo para vender en las colonias, L.  señora Martha va a comprar maíz para vender tortillas, L. señora Marilú va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo para vender. L. señora Marilú es integrante del grupo, elL. tiene 33 años D. edad, es casada y tienen 2 hijos Humberto tiene 12 años estudia y Héctor Manuel, elL. tiene su negocio D. ventas D. zapatos por catalogo, elL. solicito su préstamo para comprar sus pedidos D. zapatos, sus clientes son las muchachas y las señoras, elL. sale caminando a ofrecer los zapatos a sus clientes zapatos D. dama, caballero, niños y niñas, elL. inicio su negocio hace 2 años se fue a suscribir  a Jonacatepec, elL. solita aprendió a manejar todo lo del negocio, le intereso vender zapato y está orgullosa cuando le va bien y le pagan obteniendo ganancias, sus planes y esperanzas son seguir vendiendo y quisiera poner un negocio D. zapatos bien establecido y que sus hijos sigan estudiando, elL. está feliz con este préstamo porque va a invertir comprando zapatos, Amacuitlapilco es un pueblo tradicional en el mes D. Marzo celebran el día D. San Gabriel, también festejan el 5º. Domingo D. cuaresma hay procesión en L. tarD., también siembran en temporal sorgo y maíz, y D. riego frijol y calabaza. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Gracias por estimular a las personas con sus préstamos ya que nos ayudan mucho para seguir creciendo nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
The solidarity group known as “San Gabriel” is located in the community of Amacuitlapilco, Jonacatepec.  It consists of ten women who known one another and are neighbors.  The members will use their loans in the following manner:

•	Sra. Adelina will buy cosmetics in bulk to sell.
•	Sra. Adelfina will buy all types of candy.
•	Sra. Salustia will buy seasonal vegetables to sell.
•	Sra. Minerva will buy pigs to raise and sell.
•	Sras. Maura and María will buy feed for raising animals to sell.
•	Sra. Blanca will buy glasses and gelatins to prepare and sell.
•	Sra. Salustia will buy bread in bulk to sell in different neighborhoods.
•	Sra. Martha will buy corn for making and selling tortillas.
•	Sra. Marilú will buy shoes in bulk to sell.

Sra. Marilú is a member of the group.  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children, Humberto (a 12 year old student) and Héctor Manuel.  Marilú has a business selling shoes through a catalog.  She is requesting a loan so that she can order more shoes.  Her customers are girls and women.  She travels so that she can offer her customers shoes for women, men, and children.  Marilú started this business two years ago by signing up in Jonacatepec.  She asked to learn everything about managing this type of business and became interested in selling shoes.  Marilú is proud that she has done well and is able to generate a profit.  Her hopes and dreams incluD. continuing to sell, having a well-established shoe business, and seeing her children continue their studies.  She is happy to have this loan because she will be able to invest in the purchase of more shoes.  

The town of Amacuitlapilco traditionally celebrates San Gabriel’s Day during the month of March.  In addition, Lent is celebrated on the fifth Sunday with an afternoon procession.  This also happens to be the season for planting sorghum and corn, as well as irrigating the fields of beans and squash.  The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, “Thank you for the encouragement you proviD. through these loans because they have been a great help to people like us who want to continue growing our businesses.”

loans.use: To purchase shoes in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco R. tiene 30 años de edad, tiene una hija pequeña aunque aún no está casado ni vive directamente con la madre de su pequeña. Él vive en Viloma en la localidad de Vinto con sus padres apoyándoles en lo que puede; tiene el sueño de que muy pronto si las posibilidades económicas lo permiten pueda casarse y  tener más de cerca a la persona más importante en su vida, a su hija.
Francisco trabaja como taxista y gracias a su sacrificio también tiene ganado lechero y obtiene sabrosa leche de sus vacas todos los días. 
Francisco quiere el préstamo para que pueda comprar conejos cobayos y así obtenga mejores ingresos, él está agradecido con la gente de que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con dinero para que pueda invertir en capital de trabajo.
Francisco entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que pueda acceder a un a la construcción de una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Francisco R. is 30 years old and has a young daughter, even though he has not gotten married yet, nor does he live with the mother of his child. He lives in Viloman in the town of Vinto with his parents, supporting them as much as he can. His dream is to, his finances permitting, get married soon and be closer to the most important person in his life: his daughter. Francisco works as a taxi driver, and thanks to his sacrifice, he also owns dairy cows and obtains delicious milk from them every day. 
Francisco wants this loan so that he can purchase guinea pigs, thus increasing his income. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders, who have given him the opportunity to obtain the money he needs to invest as working capital. Francisco would like to obtain a new loan in the future so that he can start building his own house.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria nació en la provincia de la Convección del departamento del Cusco y tiene 57 años de edad. Actualmente, Gloria vive junto con sus dos hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y se dedica a la venta de jugos de naranja y tiene un puesto de venta en el populoso barrio los Incas, ella sale a vender desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde todos los días. Gloria y su pareja tienen un negocio que consiste en hacer mantenimiento de carros como por ejemplo se hace planchado y pintado de autos. Ya son varios años que se dedica este negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.

Gloria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo pintura y otras cosas más que necesita.  

Gloria es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the Province of Convección in the Department of Cusco. She is 57 years old and currently lives with her two children in Cusco, which is known as the Imperial City of the Incas. Gloria is a responsible mother who wants to move her family forward. She sells orange juice and has a vending stall in the crowded neighborhood of Los Incas. There she sells every day from 8am to 2pm. Gloria also has a business with her partner where they fix cars, such as providing paint and body work. They have been in this business for several years and have done very well as a result of the effort they put into their work.

Gloria is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy materials such as paint and other supplies that are needed. She is a responsible member of the Communal Bank “Sumac Purisisun”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To purchase automobile paint and other supplies.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana nació en la provincia de la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 57 años de edad. Actualmente, Roxana vive junto con sus tres hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en arreglar zapatos, ellos tiene una zapatería que está básicamente implementada con una maquina y con hilos. Ya son varios años que se dedican este negocio y les va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que ponen en su trabajo.

Roxana en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo cuero, zuelas y otras cosas más que necesita.  

Roxana es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Roxana was born in the province and city of Cusco and is 57 years old. She currently lives with her three children in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who gets her family ahead and has a family business fixing shoes. They have a cobbler shop with a basic set-up of a machine and thread. They have been running this business for several years already and it is going very well thanks to the effort they all put into their work.

At this time, Roxana needs a loan to buy materials like leather, soles, and other things that she needs.

Roxana is a responsible person who belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "Sumac Purisisun” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials like leather, soles, and other things that she needs

loans.name: Sara Esther

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Sara Esther le está haciendo falta los acabados y pintar la portes del exterior, también quiere colocar un portón  de herrería la frente de su casa para tener mayor seguridad. Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Desea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en el aria de producción, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene un hijo  bajo su responsabilidad, y quiere que tenga la educación necesaria y que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
The exterior of Sara Esther's house is unfinished, and the doors need to be painted.  It also needs an iron gate at the front to provide greater security.  She is seeking this loan to buy the necessary material and to pay someone to do this improvement work.

She will pay off the loan with part of the money she earns from working in a production factory, which is her source of income, since she is a single mother and has a young son whom she wants to keep in school.

loans.use: to put an iron gate in front of her house and to finish off the exterior.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge S. tiene 24 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona hipódromo de la ciudad de Cochabamba, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Él trabaja como auxiliar de oficina en una pequeña empresa de Cochabamba, tiene que trabajar para que pueda ayudarse en sus estudios y aliviane un poco el sacrificio que sus padres hacen por el para que pueda tener un mejor nivel educativo y a futuro consiga un trabajo de cargo mucho más importante.

Jorge quiere el préstamo para que pueda reparar la vieja motocicleta que tiene y así pueda desplazarse más rápido en su trabajo siendo esta motocicleta su herramienta de trabajo, él está muy agradecido con la gente de que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de mejorar su estilo de vida.
Jorge entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que pueda acceder a realizar una maestría en administración de empresas.
texts.en:
Jorge S. is 24 years old and lives with his parents in the Hipódromo area of the city of Cochabamba. He is single and has no children. He works as an office assistant for a small business in Cochabamba. He has to work in order to both help himself with his studies and to lighten his parents' load, as they have to make a sacrifice so that he can get an education and an important job in the future.

Jorge would like to use this loan to repair his old motorcycle so that he can get to work faster, thus making this motorcycle his work tool. He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for giving him the opportunity to improve his lifestyle.

Jorge would like to request another loan in the future so that he can obtain a Master's degree in Business Administration.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las 12 socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres De Éxito. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país. Aquí hace cinco ciclos se reunieron un grupo de personas para poder acceder a los créditos que ofrece la institución.  Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, venta de comida o prestan servicios como cabinas telefónicas, salones de belleza, entre otras cosas.

Aquí conocimos a Luisa María Z., tiene 21 de edad, está soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres con dos hermanos menores, en la actualidad estudia el cuarto semestre de medicina en la universidad. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras le han recibido muy bien en el grupo.

Ella se dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días, vende a sus compañeras de la Universidad, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que tiene cuatro meses que se dedica a esta actividad y que fue una amiga que la incentivó a que ingrese al mundo del comercio, que le esta yendo muy bien y que con esto se esta financiando parte de sus estudios. 

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y otros productos.
 
Su sueño es ser una gran medico. 

En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la fotografia la Señora. Zenia Mero que es la Promotora del Banco, la Señora usa lentes y está con una camiseta interior amarilla y una blusa exterior blanca.
texts.en:
In the Rocafuerte canton, 12 members of the Mujeres De Exito (Women of Success) Microfinance Institute get together every fifteen days. This place is well-known for the delicious candy that the locals make and is famous throughout the country. Fifteen loan cycles ago, a group of people came together in order to obtain the loans that this institute offers. These group members sell anything from general merchandise to food, or they provide telephone or beauty services, among other things.

Here is where we met Luisa Maria Z., a 21-year-old single woman who lives in her parents' home with her two younger siblings. She is currently in her fourth semester of premed at the university. This is her first loan cycle with the institute, and she likes it because her fellow group members have received her well.

She sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, fragrances, and women's accessories). She works every day, selling products to her classmates at the university. She sells door-to-door and by order, accepting credit from her customers and billing them weekly. She states that she has been in business for four months after a friend motivated her to enter the world of sales. Business is going well, and she has been able to pay for part of her studies with her earnings.

She will invest this loan in purchasing fragrances, fashion jewelry, cosmetics, lotions, and other products.

Her wish is to become a great doctor.

Pictured here is Ms. Zenia Mero, the bank promoter. She is wearing glasses and a yellow undershirt with a white blouse over it.

loans.use: to purchase fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, fashion jewelry, and other products.

loans.name: Dionicio Roberth

texts.es:
Dionicio M. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y aun no tiene hijos, vive en Viloma Grande ubicado en la localidad de Vinto de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él vive con sus padres  y comparte todo lo que tiene con su familia. Dionicio es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, debido a las circunstancias que le toco vivir tuvo que buscar trabajo desde joven para que pueda ayudar a su familia. La mayor parte de su tiempo la dedica a prestar su servicio como albañil, también trabaja dentro de su familia en la cría de chanchos y la alimentación del ganado lechero para la extracción de leche. 

Dionicio quiere el préstamo para comprar conejos cobayos y de esta manera pueda criarlos e incrementar los ingresos de su familia. Dionicio está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de dedicarse a la cría de conejos cobayos y así  pueda mejorar su nivel de vida.

Dionicio entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que haga crecer la pequeña granja familiar que tienen.
texts.en:
Dionicio M. is a 22-year-old single man with no children. He lives in Viloma Grande, located in the Vinto area of the city of Cochabamba. He lives with his parents and shares all that he has with his family. Dionicio is a hardworking and responsible person who, due to his life circumstances, he had to start working at a young age to help out his family. Most of the time, he works as a bricklayer. He also works with his family raising pigs and feeding dairy cows for milk extraction.

Dionicio wants to use this loan to purchase guinea pigs so that he can raise them and increase the household income. Dionicio is very grateful with the Kiva lenders because he now has the opportunity to raise guinea pigs and improve his standard of living.

Dionicio would like to request a new loan in the future so that he can expand the small family farm.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Amacuzac Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Amacuzac" esta ubicado en el estado de Morelos en México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 personas y es la segunda  vez que solicitan un crédito. La señora Cristina Domínguez Díaz es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 59 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijos, una mujer y un varón. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, negocio que inicio hace 9 años, solicita el préstamo para comprar aceite, frijol, arroz productos que utiliza en la elaboración de comida además de refrescos para su negocio, a sus clientes les gusta su comida  porque tiene muy buen sazón y siempre esta muy limpio. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta porque podrá ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias comprara material para construir su casa y poder seguir beindandoles educación a sus hijos. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien en la fotografía se llama Ana F..
texts.en:
The "Amacuzac" group is located in state of Morelos in Mexico.  It has 10 members, and this is the second time it has sought a loan.  

Cristina Domínguez Díaz is the president of the group.  She is 59, has a secondary school education, and has two children, a girl and a boy.  She has been selling food for the last nine years.  She is seeking a loan to buy oil, beans, and rice--products she uses in her cooking--as well as soft drinks for her business.  Her clients like her food because it is well-seasoned and always very hygienic.  The loan will help her increase her business, and with her gains, she wants to buy material to build a house so as to secure her children's well-being and education.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as oil, beans, rice, etc. for a food business.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam nació en la provincia de la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 26 años de edad. Actualmente, Miriam vive junto con sus dos hijos en la ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una madre responsable que saca adelante a su familia y tiene un negocio familiar que consiste en hacer mantenimiento de computadoras, el esposo de Miriam tiene un centro de atención de mantenimiento de computadoras junto con unos amigos en el centro Comercial El Carmen  en la ciudad del Cusco. 

Ya son 6 años que su esposo de Miriam se dedican este negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo.

Miriam en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar repuestos como por ejemplo cabezales de impresoras, tintas y otras cosas más que se necesita.  

Miriam es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Miriam was born in the province of the city of Cusco and is 26 years old. Presently she lives with her two children in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru). She is a responsible mother who helps her family get ahead. She has a family business providing computer maintenance. Her husband and a group of his friends have a computer maintenance center in the shopping mall ‘El Carmen’ in the city of Cusco. Miriam and her husband have been doing this work for six years now with great results thanks to the effort they put into it. 

Miriam is a responsible person and is a member of the Communal Bank ‘Sumac Purisisun’ of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, printer heads, ink and others that are needed.

loans.name: Keng

texts.en: From Siem Reap Province, Keng V. started her business over five years ago. She sells a small inventory of groceries from her home. She is 52 years old and a widow. Keng V. has one daughter who is married and helps her in the business. She sells food and some cooking supplies to her neighbors who live near her house. Keng V. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan of US $500, to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell. This will allow her to increase her income, ensuring that her entire family will attain a good standard of living.

loans.use: to accumulate more necessary grocery items to sell

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Penh S., age 48, is a married woman who is a good mother of four kids, one of whom is married, while the other three are single. She has two children who are working in different occupations in order to make a daily profit. She and her husband always use different fishing tools to fish in and around Tunle Sap River, where they can earn $8 of income each day. She has depended on this activity for more than ten years. She wishes to build up more fishing tools, such as nets, a machine, and a boat, and is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase them. Currently, Penh S. and her family reside in a wooden house in Siem Reap.

loans.use: to buy some fishing equipment, such as nets, a machine, and a boat

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 40 years old and has five children. One of her children is in school.  Lourdes is married.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business of seaweed culture in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase seaweed and materials for the culture of seaweed (bamboo, nylon etc).

Lourdes has been in this business for 15 years. Lourdes also earns additional income from buying and selling sea cucumber.

In the future, Lourdes would like to own a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed to be cultured

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Telesia needs a loan of WST $1450 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Telesia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Telesia's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Florelita

texts.en:
Florelita is 59 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Florelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and piglets.

Florelita has been in this business for 15 years. Florelita also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and piglets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera owns & operates a business selling both food & products for daily use.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Sera needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Sera joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Sera's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
Alecia is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alecia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

Alecia has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Floredeliza

texts.en:
Maria Floredeliza works hard to support four children. Maria Floredeliza is widowed and has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Maria Floredeliza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Maria Floredeliza has been in this business for nine years. Maria Floredeliza earns more income with her networking business (Avon, Natasha).

In the future, Maria Floredeliza would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Suong V., 62, is a local farmer who currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To earn a living, she always plants rice crops on her farmland, which is located near her house. She gained experience in the farming business while single. She is now a widow, and she lives with her son, who assists her in the agricultural work. Suong V. can generate around $1 in profit each day to use in the family’s need. Suong V. is going to use her first loan to purchase a cow for the purpose of breeding, so she can also raise its offspring.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the purpose of breeding

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Menchie is 44 years old and widowed with four children.

Menchie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Menchie has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income with food vending.

Menchie aspires to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ala Fereti

texts.en:
Ala owns & operates a business driving a taxi.  She has many years of experience in this business.    Ala needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase parts for the vehicle, such as tires, paints and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Ala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ala's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase parts for vehicle, such as tires, paint and equipment.

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Tun (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. May Roeun, live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three sons and two daughters.

S. stays home. Their main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a construction worker. S. is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her husband.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children who are in school, Rosanna is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosanna is 35 years old. 

Rosanna has a business buying & selling ready to wear (clothing) in the Philippines. Rosanna requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of ready to wear.

Rosanna has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rosanna would like to send children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of RTW clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets.

Lorna has been in this business for seven years. Lorna also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to send her children to school and do house repairs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and piglets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Mrs. Savon O. and her husband, Mr. Lorn Nov (pictured together), live in a village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children--one son and four daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home; two are garment factory workers, one is a weaver and another one stays at home.

Savon and her husband are farmers; they grow rice and lotus. In addition, Mr. Lorn Nov is also a horse cart driver. Savon is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice and lotus farm.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia T. is from the village of Paingon, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a 65 year-old widow and has 6 adult children. Eugenia operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store. She has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eugenia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, soy sauce and other goods for her store. Eugenia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase two sacks of rice and groceries for her sari-sari store. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Eugenia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice and groceries for her sari-sari

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda C. is from the village of Guinles. She is 59 years old. Luzviminda is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for more than 31 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP on average a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which also will be used to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and also for payment of labor in preparing the rice field. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming,and for payment of labor in preparing the rice field

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach L. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Yon Chuon, got married in 1972 and have four sons. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Thach is a weaver, while her husband is a wooden house builder. Some of his materials have broken down and do not work well; he wants to repair his materials so he can continue his business. Hence Thach is asking for a loan of $300 to help with her husband’s business by making those repairs.

loans.use: To repair construction materials for her husband.

loans.name: Sorpheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorpheap S. (pictured above) is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Chanthy Chum, is 38 years old. They live in a village off of National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1997 and have one son who is in grade five.

Sorpheap is a tailor who specializes in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. She is applying for her first loan of $500 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba B. is from the village of Loay, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old. Melba is married and has four adult children. Melba owns and operates a store that sells home care products like shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in her community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Melba joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Melba is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melba from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy home care products like shampoo, and toothpaste

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn B. is from the village of Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Rosalyn operates a family member's business in the services sector, operating a PUJ (small bus) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets for her hog raising business. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase accessories for vehicle repair. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for vehicle repair

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia O. is from the village of Estaka. She is 43 years old. Virginia is married and has 2 grown children. To make a living, Virginia runs a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for house repair. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Ms. Sophorn C. (pictured here), 30, is single and lives with her three brothers and widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away. 

Sophorn is a garment factory worker. She is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her brother to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her brother to drive to school.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Mr. Kim S. (pictured above) is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sokea Thy, is 29 years old,. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two young children, one son and one daughter.  

Mr. Kim S. is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to fill in the land around his house foundation.

loans.use: to fill in the land around his house foundation

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita D. M. is from the village of Calao, East Santiago. She is 41 years old. Melita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns & operates a business making & selling food such as banana cue. Melita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Melita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Melita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Altanchimeg, 29, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2010. Her husband drives a taxi and earns about 300,000 MNT monthly. They have an average standard of living.
