loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem Y. has been earning her daily income by planting rice on her own farmland which she inherited from her grandparent many years ago. She has a life partner in her husband who is a classical music Khmer player. He earns money by providing Khmer music for wedding parties and other ceremonies. 

They have six children: five are single, and one is married. One of Sem Y.'s children sells food for people who come to visit Teuk Char. Sem Y. will use her loan to help her daughter buy more cooking ingredients to make food to sell. Sem Y. and her husband appear in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food production

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 35 years old, married, with eight children and all of them go to school. Halima borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand  and pay her children's school fees with extra profits  from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a fisherman living in Trinidad, Bohol with his nine children. He is a widower.

Fernando has been a fisherman for 30 years. He is asking for a loan to purchase nylon, epoxy, hooks and other fishing materials. This will help him have more nets to catch more fish.

Fernando works hard to support his children. He hopes to be able to sustain their education.

loans.use: to purchase nylon, epoxy, hooks and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 58 year old widow who owns a bakery and works on a farm. She lives near Tyre and opened her shop last year. She is the only "saj" (thin pizza) baker in her town. She also makes special "katayef", a Ramadan season sweet.

At the beginning she had financial problems but the fact that she is an expert in her domain and that she works on a farm as well allowed her to provide herself with a more secure living. 

This is her first loan. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy a bakery machine and tools to open a new branch, as well as for maintenance costs in her shop. In the future, she wishes to open a big bakery and reach a larger number of clients.

loans.use: to buy a bakery machine and tools to open a new branch

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Arona A., who is in her mid-twenties, is single. She has had a tailoring business for 6 months.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Arona's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to buy more materials and start making dresses for sale.  Her dream is to buy more sewing machines and open a school for tailoring.

Arona will share this loan with her loan group "Nadia", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture Arona is second from left, second row.

loans.use: To buy more material for tailoring.

loans.name: Tita's Group

texts.en:
Tita M. is from the village of Marracuro, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 45 years old. Tita is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tita M.'s group.

Tita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Tita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Tita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a married woman with four children. She is 42 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years.

Lucena sells items like notebooks, pads of paper, and canned juices to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles.

In the future, she hopes to expand her store further.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Rhenilan

The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice per kilogram in the local community. She is also providing multi purpose cab or pedicab as her husband as the driver. loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Neema K., who is in her mid-thirties, is married with two children.  She has been running a cafe for two years.  She works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Neema's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to purchase missing food items for her cafe.  Her dream is to one day own a good restaurant.

Neema will share this loan with her loan group "Waefeso" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Neema is the tallest in a black blouse,1st from right, back row.

loans.use: To purchase missing items for her cafe.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 35 years old and married with two children.  One of her children is in school. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products for the general store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as rice, bread, and instant foods. 

In the future, Lilibeth would like to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for the general store

loans.name: Rodrigo

The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle transport) services to local community members. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. He has successfully repaid his last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5,000 PHP and was used to purchase tools needed to provide service.

This loan will be his second from HSPFI. Rodrigo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase tools & utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling pork and chicken barbecue. loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 28 years old, married, with 5 children and 4 of them go to school. Elizabeth borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pang

texts.en:
Pang Y. is a 70-year-old farmer and widowed mother who lives in Kompong Cham province. She is blessed with three married children. Pang Y. inherited farmland from her grandmother on which she grows different kinds of crops. 

Pang Y. presently faces a problem with her living conditions because her house's wall was broken and it is very hard for her and her family members to live in the house. As she doesn’t have enough cash for the necessary repairs, Pang Y. is applying for a Kiva loan to buy wooden poles to fix the wall. Pang Y., her daughter and her grandsons appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy wooden poles to repair the wall of her house

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and is a married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 14 years old. Her husband works as a Township Councilor and a fishpond operator.

Marites is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing rice for 10 years. She earns by selling her harvest to the market. Marites also provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community. She works hard to support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production/sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production/sales business.

Alejandra has been in this business for 21 years. Alejandra earns more income with hog raising.

Alejandra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of sending her children to school and doing some home improvements in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make food products to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Cherry Lou

texts.en:
Cherry Lou S., from the village of Santo Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon, is 22 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, for the past two years Cherry Lou has owned and operated a service-based business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cherry Lou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase tools needed to provide service, she is now requesting her second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. Cherry Lou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine A. O. is a married lady. Her husband is a trader and they have six children aged between twenty-three years old and twelve years old. She owns a clothing sales business in which she sells second-hand clothes to the local people. Her business is located at the busy Oile market in Kisumu. She also goes to other market centres outside Kisumu town for specific market days. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the Lake Basin. 

Dorine has been in this business for twenty years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of a permanent place to run her business, making it difficult to work for long hours as well as retain customers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes that in future, she will be importing clothes, shoes and bags. She describes herself as tolerant and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a goat corral to be have better conditions and start a business.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 35 years old. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her husband and two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Marylou is the one who sells his catch to the market.

Marylou plans to use her loan to purchase hooks, nets and other fishing materials. This will help them have more fish to sell.

In the future, Marylou hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase hooks, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Loek

texts.en:
Loek S., 67 years old, is a humble villager living in the capital, Phnom Penh, in the middle of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with three children; two of them are employed in different jobs earning an income. 

To earn a living, Loek S. and her husband are local crop farmers, growing rice and vegetables on their own farmland. Her children use their own motorbike to go to work every day. Unfortunately, their existing motorbike  has often broken down during use. Because of that, Loek S. has decided to seek a loan of $600 from Kiva, which she will use to exchange her children's broken-down motorcycle.

loans.use: To exchange her children's broken-down motorcycle.

loans.name: Raniah

texts.en:
Raniah is a 34-year-old woman, divorced and a mother of two, owner of a day care center. She lives in Beirut and opened her business in 2004. She is recognized as an expert and appreciated for her sense of security, healthy working conditions, her attention to decoration, and her special customer care. All of her clients are working women.

This is her second loan. She is requesting the loan from Al Majmoua to pay for necessary decoration in the center and to buy a van for the children's transportation. She reports that her previous loan helped her improve her living conditions. 

In the future, she wishes to open a new branch.

loans.use: To do necessary decoration and buy a van for the children's transportation.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 31 years old and is a married woman with three children. Her children are 9, 8 and 7 years old. Meriam's husband is a fisherman. Fishing has been their family's source of living for seven years. Meriam sells all her husband's catch to the market. They also have a sari-sari store that Meriam manages.

Meriam plans to use her loan to purchase a boat engine. This will help their fishing business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

texts.en:
Romualdo is a 37-year-old fisherman living in Trinidad, Bohol. He has been a fisherman for 20 years. He is asking for a loan to purchase a boat engine. This will help him expand his business and catch more fish to sell.

Romualdo works hard to support his family of a wife and 4 children. In the future, Romualdo hopes to expand his business more.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 61 years old, married and has 4 children, whose ages range from 20 to 30 years old. Her husband is a retired teacher.

Cresencia has been in the tailoring business for 8 years. She makes dresses and provides general alterations. She also buys gowns that she rents to the people in her town. Cresencia is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP to purchase more clothing and tailoring materials. She hopes to be able to make wedding gowns someday.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and tailoring materials

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela L. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Stela is married. To make a living, Stela owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like "nata de coco", popcorn & ice cream pops in the local community. She is also selling used clothing or "ukay-ukay" by going house-to-house. Stela has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Stela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. Stela is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale like popcorn. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Stela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products like  popcorn for sale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a 57-year-old married woman with 5 children, whose ages range from 21 to 28 years old. Juana is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing rice for 15 years and usually earns about 10,000 PHP from it. She has requested a loan that she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Juana works hard to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 33-year-old man, married and father of two. He lives in Tyre and works as a car mechanic. He opened his shop in 2000. He is considered an expert in his domain. His main concern is to provide his children and family with education and good living conditions.

This is his first loan with Al Majmoua and he needs one to buy a new engine for his van. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his van.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. She is 35 years old and married, with 5 children, who all attend school. Lucia has taken out a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 59 years old. Lolita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, coconuts, charcoal & other items in the local community. She is also making and serving viands like hot dogs & eggs. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Edna Antonio's Group

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nemencio

texts.en:
Nemencio is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He tills his land and prepares it well for cropping. He grows rice that he sells to the market. He has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as flour and sugar.

Nemencio is 36 years old and is a married man. He has six children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old. Nemencio's wife makes rice cakes that she sells around their neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and ingredients such as flour and sugar.

loans.name: Kwewaayo Namukozi Women's Group-Mityana

texts.en: Leticia M., 49 years old, has been operating a general merchandise retail shop in Namukozi-Mityana for the last 26 years. The happily married mother of 4 credits determination, resolve and tenacity for the longevity of her business, which she began with savings from her commercial farming business. The business generates 50,000 UGX as weekly profit. Leticia says that she will use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell. In the group photo, 2 male group's member's faces are not seen so clearly so i marked them as unpictured. One lady too was not around when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Dukundane Group

texts.fr: Stéphanie N. est agricultrice de mais, membre du groupe Dukundane, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Elle a 36 ans, elle est mariée, née au Rwanda, et elle a 4 enfants entre 3 ans et 11 ans ; trois de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Stéphanie a fini 3 ans d’école primaire, et ce crédit et son premier cycle avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 kgs de mais, payer la main d’œuvre, et autres dépenses relatives a cette activité.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de cultiver les mais en augmentant la quantité produit.  Elle voudrait devenir une agricultrice acceptable, assurer le bien être de sa famille, et éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Stéphanie N. is a maize farmer and a member of the Dukundane group, and has been a client of ACB since 2008. Born in Rwanda, she is 36 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11. Three of them attend school. Stéphanie herself completed three years of primary school.

This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use the loan to buy 10 kg of maize, and pay for labor and other business-related expenses. Her business growth strategy is to increase her production of maize as well as the amount required by the Ministry of Agriculture. She wants to become a good farmer, ensure her family’s well-being, and give her children an education.

loans.use: to buy 10 kg of maize and pay the labor for her farming activity

Alia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a 26-year-old single man who owns a bakery. He lives in Tyre and opened his shop in 2007. His bakery is in front of the general hospital; therefore, his customers are hospital patients, employees and neighbors. He offers very affordable prices.

This is Housam's third loan. He reports that the previous ones helped him support his business, which in turn allowed him to build his own house. Housam is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to reinforce his sales by increasing his stock of flour and oil. He also wants to finish building his house. In the future, Housam wishes to open a new branch and to help his brothers by hiring them at the bakery.

loans.use: to increase his stock of flour and oil and to pay for house maintenance

loans.name: Damira

texts.en:
Damira A. is 46, single and has two school-aged children. She sews Kyrgyz national traditional products, such as souvenirs, coverings and cushions made out of wool and felt. She started this activity in 2005 with initial capital of 5,000 KGS and has managed to raise her floating capital to 50,000 KGS.

Damira has applied for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase a stitching machine and cotton for her products. It will allow her to increase her sales and enlarge her client base. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business and save money to provide a good education for her children. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase a stitching machine and cotton

texts.en: Christine N. is a farmer and grows corn. She is a client of the Microfinance Institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A since 2008. She was born in Rwanda and is a 31 year-old mother of 5 children aged between 3 and 16. 4 of her children are going to school and Christine went to middle school during 6 years. This loan is her first loan cycle with ACB and she will use it to buy 20 kilos of corn, to rent a land and to pay for labor. To grow the business, her strategy is to produce more. She would like to become a well known farmer in the neighborhood of Rubavu and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy 20kg of corn, to rent a land and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50-year-old married man and the father of five children. He lives in Beirut, where he has owned a grocery store since 1987. He is devoted to serving his clients and they appreciate him very much. Ali's store is located in front of a school so his customers are mainly students, teachers and parents. He is a hardworking man trying to provide his children with the best education.

This is Ali's ninth cycle. He is requesting this loan from Al Majmoua to buy more products to boost his sales. In the future, he wishes to open a second store.

loans.use: to buy more products

loans.name: Gemma's Group

texts.en:
Gemma R. is from the village of Estrada. She is 43 years old. Gemma is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gemma R. Group.

Gemma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a food stall near the school. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional soft drinks and bread to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft drinks and bread to sell

loans.name: Policronio

texts.en:
Policronio is a 46-year-old married man living in Trinidad, Bohol.

Policronio runs a motorcycle business and has had this business for 5 years. This business earns 3000 PHP per month. He also tills a small parcel of land, where he grows rice.

Policronio is asking for a loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. This will help improve his business.

In the future, Policronio hopes for his business to improve.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife L. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Marife owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Marife is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk food and candies. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, junk food and candies

loans.name: Kaliba Development Group

texts.en: K. Prossy, who is 27 years old, has been selling food in Lugazi town food market for close to seven years now. Prossy is optimistic about the further growth of her business in the future given the high demand for most of the foods she sells such as paw-paws, cabbage, pineapples and maize. The mother of one says that her business generates 300,000 UGX as weekly profits. With this loan, she is going to purchase more foods to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more foods to resell

loans.name: Elvira Almazan's Group

texts.en:
Elvira A. is from the village of Sinamar. Elvira is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Elvira A.'s Group.
Elvira is 49 years old, married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from tending a canteen near the school. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sheril Santiago's Group

texts.en:
Sheril S. is from the village of Sto. D.. Sheril is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Sheril S.'s Group.
Sheril is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Sheril has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Sheril joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old, married, and has five children, the oldest of whom is 11 years old. Jessica's husband is a seaweed farmer and also works as a carpenter.
Jessica is a seaweed farmer. She has been in this kind of business for five years. She works hard to support her family. Jessica plans to use her loan to purchase straw, rope and other materials for seaweed farming. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase straw, rope and other materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 45-year-old married man and the father of three. He owns a shop selling underwear and pajamas. Mouhamad lives in Tyre and opened his store in 1990. His business is located in a profitable region and he is able to obtain good sales figures. In the beginning, Mouhamad encountered difficulties expanding his shop but managed to overcome them. 

This is Mouhamad's fourth loan. He reports that the previous ones helped him develop his business and augment his income. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his capital for the spring and summer seasons. In the future, Mouhamad wishes to expand even more and open a larger shop.

loans.use: To buy new spring and summer collection in good prices

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 30 years old, married and has an 11-year-old child. She works hard to support her family. Liezel is engaged in hog-raising and fishing businesses. She has a small backyard piggery where she raises pigs. She fattens the pigs then sells them to the market. Liezel's husband is a fisherman. Liezel sells his catch to the market. She has requested a loan to purchase pigs, feed and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, feed and fishing nets

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin M., 37 years old, is married and lives in the Dongkor district of Phnom Penh City. Yin M. sells groceries from her home. She has had experience in this business for many years and earns approximately $8.33 per day. To share in family responsibilities, her husband built a small workshop where he provides a vehicle washing service. This couple has been married for years and they have three school-aged children. In order to increase her income, Yin M. wishes to expand her grocery business by asking for a loan from Kiva. She will use the funds to purchase a larger amount of essential grocery items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of essential grocery items to sell

loans.name: Tuvemubujiji Group

texts.fr: Elina Byukusenge est agricultrice de mais, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Elle a 40 ans, elle est mariée, née au Rwanda, et elle a 6 enfants entre 5 ans et 23 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Elina a fini 2 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 kgs de mais, louer les champs, et payer la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter des champs à cultiver.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Elle voudrait aussi assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et construire des autres maisons d’habitation à louer.
texts.en:
Elina Byukusenge is a corn farmer and has been a client of ACB since 2008. She is 40 years old and married. Born in Rwanda, she has six children, aged 5 to 23. Four of her children go to school. Elina finished two years of secondary schooling.

This loan is her first cycle with ACB, and she is going to use her loan to buy 10 kg of corn, to lease fields, and to pay for labor. Her strategy for business growth is to add to her arable land. She would like to become a major grower in the Rubavu area. She would also like to ensure her family's well-being and to build other houses to rent out.

loans.use: to buy 10 kg of corn, to lease the field, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Tukola Women's Group

texts.en: N. William, 59 years old, has been a charcoal sales businessman for the past 15 years in the town of Lugazi. This high spirited father of 6 says he began this business with savings from his firewood sales business and that it generates 120,000 UGX of monthly profit. William will use this loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin K. is a 40-year-old married woman who currently earns a living by purchasing cashews in bulk from farmers who plant cashew trees. She and her husband then sell the cashews to their regular clients for a profit. They can generate an income of approximately $3 US per day to use for their daily expenses. Kin K. has five single children who have no jobs yet.

Kin K. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to have more funds to buy cashews in bulk for selling. This loan will help her improve her profit. Kin K. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy cashews in bulk

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is 20 years old and has been operating a fish sales business for a year. Eric is still single and helps his family through his business. He earns about 3,000 PHP per month and works hard to support his family. Eric hopes for his business to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.fr: Thérèse Mukandenzi est agricultrice de mais, commerçante, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Elle a 54 ans, elle est mariée, née au Rwanda, et elle a 4 enfants entre 16 ans et 22 ans ; tous vont a l’école.  Thérèse a fini 5 ans d’école primaire, et ce crédita est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 kgs de mais, et payer la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer l’espace de culture, et les quantités produites.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans le district de Rubavu, assurer le bien être de sa famille, et payer toujours les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Thérèse Mukandenzi is a corn farmer and merchant, and she has been a client of ACB since 2008. She is 54 years old and married. Born in Rwanda, she has four children, aged 16 to 22; all of them go to school. Thérèse finished five years of primary schooling. 

This loan is her first cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy 5 kg of corn and to pay for labor. Her strategy for business growth is to improve her arable land and her yields. 

Thérèse would like to become a major grower in the Rubavu district, to ensure her family's well-being, and always to cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy 5 kg of corn and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, 27 years old, lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She is married and has 4 children, the oldest only 6 years old.

Jenifer is a farmer. She has been growing pineapples for 5 years and earns about 3,000 PHP from it. Jenifer also buys fresh fish from the fishermen in her town and then sells them in her neighborhood. She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers for farming and fish to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for farming and fish to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia W. M. is a single woman with two children, 11 and 15 years old, whom she hopes to educate to university level. Teresia's business is located in the Waithaka area of Nairobi. She owns a food kiosk where she sells ready made food to constructors and other local people. Teresia also sells timber. She has been in business for eight years and has managed to employ two people. Teresia says that her business is profitable and that her major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well.

Teresia is using her loan of 20,000 KES to add stock to her timber business in order to expand it since it is doing very well. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to own at least two restaurants in town. Teresia describes herself as a very focused person.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Haguruka Ukore Group

texts.fr: Fréderic N. est commerçant, agriculteur de mais, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il a 29 ans, il est marie, ne au Rwanda, et il a 2 enfants entre 1 an et 3 ans.  Il a fini 4 ans d’école primaire, et ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 kgs de mais, payer la main d’œuvre et autres dépenses pour son agriculture.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’améliorer les quantités à cultiver.  Il voudrait devenir un grand agriculteur dans le secteur de Rubavu, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fréderic N. is a merchant, and he grows corn. He has been a client of ACB since 2008. Born in Rwanda, he is 29 years old and married, and he has two children, who are 1 and 3 years old. Fréderic finished four years of primary schooling, and this loan is his first cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 15 kg of corn and to pay for labor and other farm expenses. 

His strategy for business growth is to improve his yields. He would like to become a major grower in the Rubavu area and to ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy 15 kg of corn and to pay for labor

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. N. is 37 years old and married. Her husband runs a butcher shop and they have three children aged between 8 and 15 years old, whom they hope to educate to university level. 

Elizabeth's business is located in the busy Waithaka area of Nairobi. She sells maize to hotels and the local people. She has been in this business for ten years and has managed to employ three people. Elizabeth says that her business is profitable and that her major challenge is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business going well. Elizabeth is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize from the farmers in order to meet her customers' demands. She hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to become a big supplier of maize to major hotels in town. She describes herself as a visionary.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Vit

texts.en:
Vit Y. is a 41-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Her husband is a cashew vendor who buys the cashews from his neighbors and other villagers at a reasonable price, and then sells them for a profit. He can usually earn around $1.25 of profit each day.

In order to earn extra profit and to make her husband’s business more successful, Vit Y. will be using her loan for her husband to buy more cashews for resale. This couple is blessed with five children; one is still enrolled in school and the other four are married and living in their own houses. Vit Y. and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy additional cashews for resale.

loans.name: Twongere Umusaruro Group

texts.fr: Esdras Gakuru est agriculteur de mais, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Il a 48 ans, il est marie, ne au Rwanda, et il a 8 enfants entre 1 an et 25 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école, et Esdras a fini 3 ans d’école poste-primaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 kgs de mais, main d’œuvre, et location du champ.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de cultiver les mais en augmentant l’espace de cultiver.  Il voudrait s’autofinancer, et aussi bâtir beaucoup de maisons d’habitation a louer pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
Esdras Gakuru is a corn farmer and has been a client of ACB since 2008. He is 48 years old and married. Born in Rwanda, he has eight children, aged 1 to 25. One of his children goes to school. Esdras has finished three years of post-primary schooling. 

This loan is his first cycle with ACB, and he is going to spend his loan on 5 kg of corn, manual labor, and leasing farm fields. His strategy for business growth is to grow corn by adding to his arable land. 

He would like to be self-financing and also to build many houses to rent out, so as to increase his revenues.

loans.use: Achat de 5 kgs de mais, main d'oeuvre, location du champ

loans.name: Ariungerel

texts.en: Ariungerel A. is 38 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent on someone’s plot of land. Ariungerel and her husband operate a small tire repair shop and also sell engine oil.  They have operated this business for the last three years and have gained a lot of experience over the years. She also works at the local hospital as a cleaner. From the beginning, the family business has been doing well, with business capital increasing from 300,000 MNT to 4,00,.000 MNT.  Ariungerel dreams of owning a larger tire shop.  She also hopes to build a small wooden house in the future.  She has taken out two loans from Credit Mongol already and has used them appropriately. She is requesting a loan to start a new engine oil kiosk.

loans.use: To start a new engine oil kiosk

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a married woman who lives in Trinidad, Bohol, with her family. She has had a sari-sari store for 5 years. She sells items like shampoo, canned goods to the people in her community. She usually earns about 5000 PHP per month with her business.

Aurea is requesting a loan of 9000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as shampoo and soft drinks.

In the future, Aurea hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as shampoo and soft drinks

loans.name: Margina

texts.en:
Margina is 37 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 13 years old.

Margina sells RTW clothes like shirts and jeans. She also sells slippers, cooking pots and pale. She has been in this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more items to sell, like shirts and slippers. Margina hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like shirts and slippers

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is a married woman who lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has 3 children. She has a fish selling business. She buys directly from fishermen and sells the fish to the market. Generosa is also a seaweed farmer.

Generosa has requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat. In the future, she hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a 43-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 6 children, the oldest of whom is 17 years old.

Dominga is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 20 years. She sells her harvest to the market. Dominga also sells fish caught by her husband, who is a fisherman. Dominga works hard to support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia is a married woman with 8 children. She is 48 years old and has had a sari-sari business for 25 years. She sells items like soft drinks and detergent to the people in her community.  Aside from the store, Laurencia also maintains a small backyard piggery. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Laurencia is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase canned goods and other items to sell.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and other items to sell

loans.name: Djankishi

texts.ru:
Djankishi A. rodilsya v 1956 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye pomoqayut yemu po rabote. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. 
Djankishi uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom, on delayet kanservirovanniye frukti i ovoshi a takje soleni. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit frukti i ovoshi dlya podqotovki na konservi i soleni dlya razvitiya i uludsheniya svoyeqo bizssa. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyey jeni. Ranshe ona zanimalas etim delom no potom ona zabolela i seychas yeyo muj zanimayetsya etim biznessom.
texts.en: Djankishi A. was born in 1956. He is married and has two children who help him in his work. He lives in the Absheron Region together with his wife and beloved children. For the last nine years, he has been canning fruits and vegetables as well as making marinades. At present he needs 200 AZN in order to buy fruits and vegetables to make preserves and marinades to build his business further. He has learned his trade from his wife. She used to run this business but later on she had gotten ill, and now her husband  has taken over.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nairi

texts.en:
Nairi N. was born in 1960 in Ijevan city. He is married and has four children: three daughters and a son, who is serving in the Armenian army now. Nairi’s two daughters are married and live separately, and the youngest is a student. Nairi lives in Achajur village within the area of Ijevan.

Nairi and his wife have farmed and raised animals for a long time. They have a fruit orchard and grow grapes, wheat and oats (which they use as a fodder for their farm animals) as well. Nairi and his wife raise pigs and cows and are also beekeepers.

With income from his farm Nairi was able to pay for his children’s education, organized his daughter’s wedding and bought necessary furniture for his home. Now with his income from farming, Nairi supports his son in the army and pays for his younger daughter’s education.

This is Nairi’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon. He is now asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy a bull calf and some beehives for his farm.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf and some beehives

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines M. is forty years old, married and has three kids. Her oldest child is twenty years old. She dries and sells fish. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells all his catch to the market.

Ines has requested a loan to buy more fishing nets and other materials. This will help Ines catch and process more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and other materials

loans.name: Toir

texts.en:
Toir M. is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells groceries. Toir is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals.

Toir launched his business over three years ago. He and his son have a lot of experience working in this type of trade. Toir’s business is known for its reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. While he owns a small storage facility in a local market, one of his plans for the near future is to buy a building for his grocery business so that he can own instead of rent.

Toir is seeking a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase foodstuffs to expand his grocery’s inventory. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he hasn’t completed due to financial constraints.

About Tajikistan

Tajikistan is known for its rich place in history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the farthest reach of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged its already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

About IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients have access to reasonable financial services. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for his grocery store

loans.name: Karabek

texts.en:
S. Karabek is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. His wife helps him with their household expenses now that she is a merchant with a stall in the oriental market in Shahrituz. Karabek has worked in agriculture for 15 years. The biggest problem he has is a lack of funding. His plans for the future are to succeed in establishing more farmland and to be able to help his children build their homes. He has requested this loan to invest in farm supplies.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and herbicides for his farm

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson M. is a married man and has four children between the ages of seventeen and three.  He hopes to give them a good education to the university level.  Samson's business is located in  the busy Ngara area in Nairobi. He sells charcoal to the local people. He has been in this business for twelve years and has managed to employ one person. Samson says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Samson is using his loan of 70,000 to buy stocks of charcoal to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future diversify into the transport business, having bought himself a matatu.  Samson describes himself as determined, devoted and caring.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 42 years old.  She is a married woman and has 4 children. Her oldest child is 15 years old.

Roselyn is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Roselyn also raises pigs in her backyard and manages a sari-sari store. She sells the pigs at the market.  Roselyn does her best to manage her time between her businesses and family. She hopes for her ventures to prosper.

Roselyn's loan will be used to purchase feeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is married and has eight children, all of whom have graduated from school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  For the past 20 years, she has been operating a coconut vending business, selling at the market to market goers and passersby.  In addition, she also sells brooms to contribute to her income. 

With the loan for 10,000 Kshs, Nzingo wants to purchase sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase coconuts to sell

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.en:
M. Habibulo is 48 years old. He is married and with his wife they are blessed with 3 children. Habibulo makes a living planting vegetables and wheat. In addition to this farming, he also raises cattle to provide extra income for his family. 

Since Habibulo lacks financial resources, he is hoping to borrow 9000 Somoni so he can purchase additional farm inputs to cultivate his farm and plant vegetables. Some of this loan will be used to pay for laborers who will help him plant the crops. Some will help pay for food to sustain him and his laborers during their work. Habibulo wants to sustain his farming business and hopefully grow it so he can eventually have a hectare of farmland to cultivate and provide for the future of his family.  
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is 39 years old and has 3 children. Her oldest child is 13 years old.

Rosita is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 6 years. She earns income by selling her harvest at the market. Rosita also sells fish around her neighborhood. She buys the fish from fishermen in her town.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
Mehrinso is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. Mehriniso is engaged in trading. She sells women and children's clothing and has been in this business for 13 years.  She always tries to expand her business, which helps her to improve her living conditions and feed her family. 

Mehriniso would like to get a loan 9000 Somoni  to purchase new woman and children’s clothes for the spring season. She thanks all lenders who support her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
O. Matluba is 41 years old. She lives in Dushanbe city with her husband, three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a businessman. 

For over 6 years, Matluba has been running her own business. She is engaged in clothing sales. Matluba sells children’s clothes in the market of Korvon in Dushanbe.  Earlier, she traded in the Center Market.   Matluba orders her goods from China and has a regular supplier.  She has a commercial shop the size of 1.5x2 meters, which she obtained  two years ago.   

Thanks to her business income, Matluba is able to provide for her family and pay for her children’s education.  Matluba would like to get a loan of US$1800 to purchase new goods and expand her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

loans.use: buy more children’s clothes to sell in her shop

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a married woman with six children -- five are attending school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mealii has operated a cashew nut business, selling at the market to market dwellers. Mealii faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, the supply for cashew nuts is lower and the demand is higher compared to the dry summer season where the supply is higher while the demand is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the loan for 50,000 Kshs, Mealii  wants to start a livestock selling business, purchase livestock to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start a livestcok selling business, and to purchase livestock to resell.

loans.name: Kiyomidin

texts.en:
Kiyomidin lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. He is a responsible person who takes care of his family.  His wife is not working because she is looking after their children.  

Kiyomidin is engaged in animal husbandry. He has been in this business for 10 years. He purchases cattle from the market, fattens them, and sells them at a profit. He trades in the markets of Eganbay, Sultonobod, and Rudaki in Dushanbe city. Kiyomidin would like to get a loan of 7000 Somoni to purchase additional cattle and expand his business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson S. O. is fifty-six years old and married. His wife is a businesslady and they have five children aged between twenty-three years old and ten years old. His business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya. It is a rich agricultural area known for production of sugarcane and commonly known as the sugar belt region.

He sells kerosene and diesel to the local people. Besides these items he also supplies milk to the local people. He has been in business for five years now. Nelson says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 to purchase more diesel and kerosene to resell. He hopes to grow his business and in the future purchase a plot of land where he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and kerosene for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine N. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. Catherine has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Catherine sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Catherine has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of charcoal.

The main business challenges for Catherine include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house.   Catherine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. Her husband is employed and he contributes to upbringing of his children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Binti faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her area of operation. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase cooking fat, oil, wheat flour, sugar, beans and potatoes. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat, oil, wheat flour, sugar, beans and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Saidova Mavjuda lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. She is a hardworking woman, who sells fabrics for sewing women’s national dresses in the market of Korvon in Dushanbe city. Mavjuda has been in this business for 32 years. She imports her goods from China. Her daily amount of income on average is 500 Somoni. But during summer her daily income increases up to 2000 Somoni per a day. Mavjuda would like to get a loan of $1100 US for purchasing of new goods, which attracts her customers. She thanks all lenders who allow her to increase her living standards.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new fabrics

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard H. lives with her husband and son in Brnakot, a village in the Syunik region. Alvard and her family members have improved their lives with the help of loans borrowed from SEF International. A cattle farm and land cultivation generate the main source of income for Alvard and her family. For the spring, Alvard needs to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer in order to create income opportunities for this year.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and fertilizer

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en: Alvard lives with her husband and two children in the village of Argina. The family's main income comes from agriculture and horticulture. The family has a cattle farm and grows apricot trees. Alvard’s husband has a tractor which gives him the opportunity for additional income during the high season. Currently the agricultural machinery requires repair before the busy season starts. This loan will cover the costs of repair work.

loans.use: to repair machinery

loans.name: Fondo

texts.en:
Fondo is a married man with three children, one who attends school while two are still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, he has operated a hawking business, and he moves from door to door selling clothes to his neighbours.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. Fondo dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more produce for resale and buy more seedlings for more planting

loans.name: Rauf

texts.ru: Rauf S. 27 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Rauf uje 7 let kak jivet v Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. On okonchil shkolu i kolledj i potom nachal rabotat. Rauf 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom taxista. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy toje taxist.
texts.en: Rauf S. is 27 years old. He is single without children. For 7 years, he has been living together with his parents. He graduated from high school and college, and then started working. He has been working as a taxi driver for five years. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy spare parts to repair his car. He has learned this trade from his uncle, who is also a taxi driver.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Looking Town Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Looking Town” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Isata C. is the leader of this group. The  29-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 4 children. With many years of experience in business, Isata sells vegetable oil, margi, salt, palm oil, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items at a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable oil, margi, salt, palm oil, etc., in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en: Arevik G. lives with her husband and two children in Kurtan, a village in the Lori region. The family’s main source of income comes from agriculture and horticulture – growing apple trees, walnut trees and pear trees. Arevik stocked up with cattle food for the winter, but since spring is coming late to the region and the cattle can’t yet live on the fields, Arevik has applied for a loan to purchase more cattle food.

loans.use: to purchase cattle food

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en: Eduard M. lives with his wife and two children in Stepanavan. Eduard and his wife are engaged in agriculture and horticulture. Eduard’s sons help their parents. The produce satisfies their family needs; they sell the excess. Eduard has applied for a loan to purchase cattle food.

loans.use: to purchase cattle food

loans.name: Abdulla

texts.ru: Abdulla A. 23 qoda. On jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Abdulla ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji rassteniy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit sajenci i semena raznix redkix rassteniy tak kak seychas sezon dlya posadki.
texts.en: Abdulla A. is 23 years old.  He lives in the  Absheron region with his family.  Abdulla is not married and does not have children.  He has been selling plants for two years.   Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy seedlings and seeds from different rare plants since this is the season for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and seeds from rare plants

loans.name: Norik

texts.en: Norik P. lives with his wife and mother in Tolors, a village in the Syunik region. Norik is disabled. He works as a school guard. However, the main income for this household comes from farming and land cultivation. Norik has applied for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel for the spring season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor José Alberto tiene 45 años de edad está casado con la señora Amparo con quien tiene tres hijos, el vive en la zona de Esmeralda carretera a Sacaba una provincia de la ciudad de Cochabamba.
José es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable el tuvo una vida muy triste desde pequeño ya que con la única que se crio fue con su madre ya que el padre ni siquiera lo reconoció, él y su madre se vinieron de la ciudad de Potosí y ella se puso a trabajar para poderlo sacar adelante a José  pero el solo pudo terminar el colegio ya que se puso a trabajar desde muy joven ya que la madre se enfermo y a él  toco trabajar y no podía estudiar al mismo tiempo, ya que su empleo era de albañil su madre falleció y él se quedo solo y ahí fue cuando la conoció a su esposa la Señora Amparo quien siempre la apoya en todo momento. 

José trabaja con su vehículo prestando los servicios de radiotaxi, el trabaja desde muy temprano en el recojo de escolares y al mismo tiempo tiene usuarios que lo buscan por lo responsable que es en su trabajo, el solicita el crédito para la compra de un tanque de gas de para su vehículo y de esa manera podrá tener mayores ingresos y hacer que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y realizar una carrera, ya que el sueña con una vida mejor para sus niñas que él dice que quiere un futuro mejor para ellas.
texts.en:
Señor José Alberto, age 45, is married to Señora Amparo, with whom he has three children. He lives in the area of the Esmeralda Highway in Sacaba, a province of the city of Cochabamba.

José is a very hardworking and responsible man. He had a sad life from when he was young. His mother raised him alone since his father abandoned them. He and his mother came to the city of Potosí, and she went to work so that José could get ahead. He was only able to finish high school, however, since he had to go to work at a young age because his mother was sick, and he wasn’t able to work and study at the same time. He was working as a bricklayer when his mother died, and he was alone when he met his wife, Señora Amparo, whom he has always supported.

José works with a loaned vehicle providing radiotaxi services. He works from early in the morning picking up students and also has regular customers that look for him because he is responsible in his work.

He is applying for the loan in order to purchase a gas tank for his vehicle. In this way, he will be able to have better income and make it possible for his children to be able to finish high school and begin careers. He dreams of a better life for his children, and he says that he wants a better future for them.

loans.use: to buy a gas tank.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, none of whom are in school.
