She also takes care of additional family members (sistes-in-laws). Harriet has a business of drug shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. Harriet has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of drugs. 

She also generates additional income through farming.The main business challenges for Harriet include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of drugs and pharmaceutical syrups

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married with one child who is two years old. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.  For the past two years, he has operated a fresh milk selling business; he sells from door to door to shop owners in his area of operation.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting, he wants to purchase a cooler for transporting milk for sale. He decided to work with Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler for transporting milk for sale.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and phone calling cards.

For over five years, he has operated a fresh milk selling business, he sells from the market to shopkeepers and neighbours. Martin faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and perishable products in his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a cooler box to be used for distribution of milk and to add more milk for sale. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler to be used for distribution of milk, and to add more milk for sale

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan A. lives with his mother, wife, and two children in Katnaghbyur village, in the Lori region. The family earns income by farming. Vachagan has his own machinery, which is very useful in running the business.
 
Vachagan has applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds and to renovate the cattle house.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and to renovate the barn

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es: La señora Ricarda García tiene 51años es viuda vive juntamente con sus 4 hijos que le ayudan en las faenas agrícolas y cuidado D. ganado en la comunidad D. Corani Pampa  están a 72 km D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, Doña Ricarda García es agricultora produce papa, locoto necesita un capital para construir vivienda en su lote en Cercado Itocto Kara Kara, la señora Ricarda García es D. familia humilD. trabajadora y responsable, para ella es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos D. la ciudad además les piden muchos requisitos. Se tuvo la iniciativa D. ir a esa zona a otorgar crédito, la señora Ricarda esta muy contenta D. tener la oportunidad D. conseguir un crédito, asi podra construir la vivienda y sus hijos podrían vivir en mejores condiciones con los servicio básicos necesarios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ricarda García, 51, is a widow living with her four children who help her with her farming chores and to care for livestock in the community of Corani Pampa which is 72 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.

Mrs. Ricarda García farms potatoes and peppers and needs capital to build a dwelling on her lot in Cercado Itocto Kara Kara.  Mrs. Ricarda García is from a humble, hard working and responsible family.  For her it is very difficult to go to banks in the city; besides, they ask for too many requirements.

There was the initiative to go to that zone to offer loans.  Ricarda is very happy to have the opportunity to get a loan that will make it possible for her to build a dwelling and her children live in better conditions with needed basic utilities.

loans.use: to build a dwelling.

loans.name: Twikure Mu Bukene Group

texts.fr: Farida M. est membre du groupe solidaire Twikure mubukene, elle est née à Rutsiro-Rwanda. Elle  est mariée et il a deux enfants entre 6ans et 4 ans, lui a 23 ans, son niveau d’éducation est 1 ère année secondaire.  Ce prêt est le deuxième cycle avec ACB., et elle a une bonne histoire de remboursement. Elle veut utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 habits doubles et orignaux de dames et frais de transport pour son business.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter les quantités vendues, en sollicitant beaucoup des prêts.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande commerçante, et s’autofinancer.  Pour la famille, elle voudrait payer des frais d’études pour ses enfants, et bâtir une maison d’habitation.  Elle a aussi une maison à louer pour augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en: arida M. is a member of the Twikure mubukene solidarity group. She is born in Rutsiro, Rwanda. She is married, with two children, six and four years of age. She is 23 years old. Her education level is first year of high school. This loan is her second cycle with ACB, and she has a good payment history. She wants to use her loan to purchase 15 ladies’ outfits, some  alike, and some different, and to pay transportation expenses for her business. Her business strategy is to increase her sales volume by continuing to take out loans. She would like to have a big business and achieve financial independence. As to her family, she would like to pay the school fees for her children, and to build a house to live in. She also has a house she rents out to increase her revenues.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' outfits for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. lives in the Makerere Kikoni neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 5 children, none of whom are in school.  Margaret has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Margaret sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.  Margaret has requested for a loan of 1000000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through a restaurant.The main business challenges for Margaret include transportation and seasonality.  Her aspiration is to build her own house.   Margaret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. For the past six months he has operated an open market selling business, he sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby.  

Willy has faces a major challenge of perishable products in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase beans, wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal and firewood to use for cooking in a restaurant. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal and firewood to use for cooking

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: W. Gorret lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Gorret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail. Gorret has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Gorret  include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house. Gorret lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household items and food to his neighbours and passersby. Patrick faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During holiday season the demand for his products is high compared to the month of January to June. He dreams of expanding his business to be a wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase sack of beans, rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Agnes Katunge

texts.en:
Agnes is a widowed 43 year-old lady. She sells food to the locals of Katingani, in Emali town.  She has been doing this for two years. 

Agnes has applied for a business loan so that she can expand her business by adding more stock to her food stall. 

She is hopeful that from the profits of her trade, she will be able to give her children a better education. She believes that if her business grows, she will be able to be economically self-reliant .

loans.use: to add more food items to her stall

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina nació en la provincia de la ciudad de Chumvilicas y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Valentina se dedica a la venta de pasto de forma ambulatoria y también se dedica a la crianza de animales. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. Valentina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar queso y carne de la ciudad de Chumvilicas.  

Valentina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Valentina was born in the province of the city of Chumvilicas and is 31 years old. Presently, Valentina sells pasture from place to place and also breeds animals. She has been doing this for a year with excellent results thanks to the effort she puts into her work. 

She is requesting the loan to buy cheese and meat from the city of Chumvilicas. Valentina is a responsible person and is a member of the Communal Bank ‘Sumac Purisisun’ of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy cheese and meat from the city of chumvilicas.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with one child who attends school. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling as retail to his neighbours and passersby. Salim faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and fats for resale. He decided to join Yehu after witnessing other members benefiting from the program.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, rice, sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and fats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four bales of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam A. lives in the Lugala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Miriam has a business of selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Miriam sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. Miriam has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Miriam include thieves and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house. Miriam lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes for resale

loans.name: James Muthami

texts.en:
James is a 53-year-old man, married with one child. He sells second-hand shoes in Gikomba market. He sells the shoes in bulk to other small scale traders. This is his primary business which he has been doing for the last eight years.

James finds this business profitable and is very optimistic about his future. He has applied for a business loan as a first cycle loan from KADET LTD., so that he can expand his business by adding more stock of shoes for sale. He is hopeful that from the profits of his trade, he will be able to give his family a better life. 

He desires to expand and open another branch for his business and give his child a good college education.

loans.use: To buy more stock for sale.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 38 years old. She is a widow with children, and she comes from Kisumu City. 

Rosemary has a retail shop that she has been running for the past seven years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use the money to add stock to her shop, including cooking oil, bread, one sack of sugar and one sack of rice. Rosemary earns a profit of KES 12,000, and that money helps her to provide for her children's needs and ensures that they are in school by paying their school fees on time.

Rosemary hopes to have a wholesale business in the future instead of retail. She also desires to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, bread, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret K. is a 45-year-old woman who is married with six children between the ages of 6 and 27 years. She sells cereals as a primary business but also practices seasonal farming in her land. Her five-year-old business in cereals is able to give her Kshs 10,000 every month as income.

Margret has applied for our education loan as a fourth cycle loan so that she can pay school fees for her children. She is also servicing another business loan which she has been repaying well without any issues.	 

She hopes to expand her cereals business in the future and be able to sell cereals in wholesale.  She believes she is courageous, hardworking and an opportunist who never lets good opportunities pass her by.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Vicsia Maria

texts.es: Vicsia Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de comida. Hace más de 16 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita este crédito. Ella inicio vendiendo en su vivienda, pues la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ella ofrece unos deliciosos platillos, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y disfruta de su actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, bolsas, platos, vasos, verduras entre otros productos necesarios. Su deseo es acondicionar su negocio y surtirlos con mucho productos solicitados por la comunidad y con los que muchas veces no tiene en existencia, así mismo trabajará mucho con su cónyuge, para lograr la meta de educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vicsia María’s business is selling food.  She’s had the business for over 16 years so this isn’t her first loan request.  

She started out selling from home because the majority of her customers know that she offers delicious dishes.  She has shown herself to be a responsible persona and she enjoys her activity.

The requested loan is to buy basic grains, bags, plates, glasses and vegetables, among other necessary products.  Her wish is to equip her business and stock it with lots of the products requested by the community and which she sometimes does not have available.  She will also work hard with her spouse to reach the goal of educating their children.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bags, plates, glasses and vegetables, among other necessary products

loans.name: Francisco Pavel

texts.es: Francisco Pavel tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Con mucho esfuerzo logro obtener este negocio. El inicia esta actividad hace más de 8 años, pues cuando inicio solamente con muy pocos productos pues no tenía el capital suficiente para aumentar su inventarios, pues con el paso del tiempo fue que con la ayuda de los financiamientos le ayudaron a crecer con este tipo de actividad. El se encarga de realizar todas las labores de su hogar. El quiere realizar este financiamiento para la compra  granos básicos, queso, pollo, huevos, gaseosas, jabón y golosinas. Su deseo es hacer su negocio más grande.
texts.en: Francisco Pavel, 57, has a general store that he was able to open with a lot of effort.  He began this business more than 8 years ago but he started with only a few products since he didn’t have enough capital to increase his inventory.  As time went by and with some financing help he was able to grow the business.  He takes care of all of the work in his house.  Francisco will use the loan to buy basic grains, cheese, chicken, eggs, soft drinks, soap and sweets.  His wish is to enlarge the business.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cheese, chicken, eggs, soft drinks, soap and sweets

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children, four boys and three girls. Five of her children attend school while one is still young for school. For the past two years, she has operated a palm leaves selling business for use in roofing houses, and she sells at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Kadzo faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transporting palm leaves in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchasepalm leaves and resell them at a profit. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves and resell them at a profit

loans.name: Eric Dawo

texts.en:
Eric is a 46 year-old married man with three children, aged 21, 17 and 15 years. He sells second-hand shoes in Gikomba market. He has been doing this for the last twelve years. He finds it profitable and is very optimistic about his future.

Eric has applied for a business loan as a first cycle loan so that he can expand his business by adding more stock of shoes for sale. 

He is hopeful that from the profits of his trade, he will be able to give his family a better life. He hopes to run a wholesale shop for selling shoes.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Tagavuma

texts.en:
Tagavuma is married with three children, two boys and one girl, two of whom attend school while one is too young for school. They live at a house that they own, that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the cost of purchasing thread and needles for her business.

For over fifteen years, she has operated a tailoring business; she operates from home whereby her potential customers are her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a palm leaves selling business, also selling coconuts and paraffin, which contributes to her living. Tagavuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation. She purchase her products from the town center and transports them to the village for resale.

With the Kshs 80,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase cloth, material, paraffin and coconuts for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, material, paraffin and coconuts for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow with five children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years she has operated a fish-selling business, and she sells in a shop and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of fish, bundles of maize, flour and sugar. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fish, bundles of maize, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Najaira Yaoska

texts.es: Najaira Yaoska tiene 27 años de edad, junto a su esposo tiene 1 hijo y esta a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer sus servicios en un kiosco. La ubicación es en el parque de la ciudad, por lo que sus inicios se dan con el apoyo de su esposo juntos han depositado una gran inversión en este negocio, fue así que decide establecer este medio de vida que le brinda ingreso para el hogar todos los días. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas, hamburguesas, batidos, hot dog, café, sopas entre otros productos. Ella sueña con mantener siempre su negocio y obtener más clientes.
texts.en: Najaira Yaoska is 27 years old. She and her husband have a son. Najaira's business is a small food stand located in the city park. She started the business with money she and her husband saved, and it now brings in income daily for their home. The requested loan will be used to buy candy, soda, bread, cookies, hamburgers, milk shakes, hot dogs, coffee, and soup, among other food products. Najaira dreams of being able to maintain her business and to gain more customers.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soda, bread, cookies, hamburgers, milk shakes, hot dogs, coffee, and soup, among other food products.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a divorced man with seven children, four of whom attend school while three have graduated from school. They own a house that has piped water but not electricity. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past four years, he has been a fisherman; he does fishing and sells the fish to his neighbours and market dwellers.  

Yusuf faces a major challenge of the low seasons and high seasons in his business. Especially during the month of June, he experiences difficulties of fishing at the ocean.  He dreams of running a seafood stall and becoming a big supplier of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase two fishing nets, one wooden boat, and an ice cooler box. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase two fishing nets, one wooden boat and an ice cooler box

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes nació en la ciudad de Vilcabamba de la provincia de Convención del departamento del Cusco y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Lourdes vive en hermosa ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú) y se dedica a la venta de artesanía para turistas que visitan la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va excelente gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. Lourdes en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para una maquina tejedora para elabore mas chompas de lana de alpaca. 

Lourdes es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Lourdes was born in the city of Vilcabamba of the province of Convencion, Department of Cusco and is 38 years old. She is currently living in the beautiful Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Peru) and sells handicrafts to the tourists who visit the city. She has been doing this for 15 years with excellent results thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

She is requesting the loan to buy a loom to make more alpaca woolen sweaters. Lourdes is a responsible person and is a member of the Communal Bank ‘Sumac Purisisun’ of the Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy a loom.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert R. O. is forty years old and married. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores, and they have four children aged between fifteen years old and ten years old to whom they hope to give good education to the university level. 

His business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya. It is a rich agricultural area known for production of sugarcane and commonly known as the sugar belt region. He sells mattresses, utensils, blankets and other items to the local people. He has been in business for six years now and has managed to give employment to one person. Herbert says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 to add more mattresses for sale. He hopes to grow his business and in the future make sales of over kes 50,000. He describes himself as focussed and intelligent.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses for resale

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina, de 41 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Iván de 43 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. El negocio de Alejandrina es la venta de Películas, canciones, documentales, dibujos animados, en formato DVD, ella aprovecha las ferias dominicales de la ciudad de Pichanaki para vender su producto, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda por los DVD, resultándole muy rentable.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo para su trabajo sin descuidar su hogar, asimismo le hace independiente. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar DVD, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda de videos más adelante, con la cual obtenga mejores ingresos económicos. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más DVD, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, age 41, is a cheerful and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Iván, age 43, and their two beloved children who are the main reason behind all of her efforts. Alejandrina has a business selling movies, music videos, documentaries, and cartoons on DVD format. She takes advantage of the Sunday fairs in the city of Pichanaki to sell her products because she knows there is great demand for DVDs. Her business has profitable results. What she enjoys most about her job is having time to work without neglecting her household duties, thereby allowing her to be independent. She has been in this business for three years and considers the most difficult part to be carrying her DVDs with her, but she knows that this is part of her job and is willing to do it. Later on, she wants to open a video store so that she can generate more income.

This is her third loan with MFP. Alejandrina is willing to complete her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is an active participant in her group. The loan of 600 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more DVDs so that she can offer her customers a wider variety.

loans.use: To purchase more DVDs.

loans.name: Alejandra Cristina

texts.es: Alejandra Cristina tiene 31 años, por lo que tiene 3 hijos que están a su cargo. La señora se dedica a una pulpería, principalmente golosinas, pan, detergentes, refrescos naturales, galletas entre otros productos. Este es el primer financiamiento que realiza, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Pues los inicio con ahorros propios, para comenzar su actividad. Con este crédito comprara golosinas, refrescos, galletas y detergentes. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que en donde ofrezca muchas cosas.
texts.en: Alejandra Cristina is 31 years old and has three children. She owns a small grocery store, selling candy, bread, laundry detergent, soda, and cookies, among other things. She started her business with her own savings. Alejandra Cristina has been looking for a way to increase her family's income. This is her first loan, and she will use it to buy candy, soda, cookies, and laundry detergent. Her goal is to stock a greater variety of products in her store.

loans.use: To purchase candy, soda, cookies, and laundry detergent.

loans.name: Luvuni

texts.en:
Luvuni is married but has no child. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years, Luvuni has operated a vegetable and fruit selling business, selling at retail to local customers. She also operates a water distribution business and real estate houses, which contribute to her income. Luvuni dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Luvuni plans to use this 30,000 KES loan to purchase potatoes, cabbages, mangoes and building materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, cabbages, mangoes and building materials

loans.name: Nestor Jr.

texts.en:
Nestor Jr. A. is from the village of Palabotan Dupax Del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Nestor Jr. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Nestor Jr. has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nestor Jr. joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nestor Jr. is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nestor Jr. from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Palabotan Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Genny

texts.es:
En el año 1977 Genny  V. D. Benítez, mujer casada y con 3 hijos en las edades D. 26 a 34 años,  despertó su gusto por embellecer la imagen personal y profesional D. la gente, así fue como empezó capacitándose  y practicando lo aprendido en  diversas salas D. belleza  D. la ciudad amurallada D. Colombia, Cartagena D. Indias, donD. adquirió gradualmente  una clientela propia. En el año 1985 cuando contrajo matrimonio por sugerencia D. su esposo, instaló su salón D. belleza en su casa, su experiencia y seriedad en el servicio la llevó a incrementar su clientela  y hoy su negocio es muy reconocido en el barrio. Su esposo es taxista y maneja  ingresos  variables y el negocio que con su apoyo inició, ha servido D. mucho para el  sostenimiento D. este hogar y para lograr sueños conjuntos, como la educación D. sus hijos. Actualmente Genny esta ahorrando para  adquirir su vivienda propia y esta es su   meta y gran desafío, al que ella y su cónyuge  se han propuesto, desD. hace mucho tiempo.
Su credikiva es el octavo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los anteriores ha logrado capitalizar su microempresa, adecuar  el local  y comprar diferentes equipos muy  necesarios para el buen manejo D. ella.   Su credikiva lo invertirá en la compra D. productos para  la Belleza Capilar  en mayor volumen, con  los cuales ahorrará y también los negociará entre sus clientes,  que al pedirle asesoría se convierten en un mercado potencial para intervenirlo.  En un futuro  Genny  espera hacer más confortable sus instalaciones y ella sueña con  tener un local a un lado D. la casa, la que mas adelante planea comprar, y en lo que ella y su esposo están dirigiendo todos sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
Genny V. D. Benítez is married and has 3 kids who range in age from 26 to 34 years old.  In 1997 she took an interest helping people improve their personal and professional appearance.   As a result, she began to teach herself and to practice what she learned from various beauty salons located in Cartagena, Columbia, where she gradually gained a customer base.  In 1985, the year she married her husband, she opened a beauty salon in her home. 

Her experience and dedication to her work lead to an increased customer base.  Today her business is very well known in her neighborhood.  Her husband is a taxi driver and his income varies.  Genny’s business, that she started with the help of her husband, has aided greatly in sustaining their home and in reaching their common goals, such as their children’s education.  

Currently, Genny is saving in order to acquire their own home, for which she and her husband have been budgeting for a long time. 

This will be her eighth Kiva loan through Funcación Mario Santo Domingo.  The previous loans served as start-up capital for her small business.  She was able to get it ready and buy the necessary equipment.  

She plans to use the loan to buy hair care products, in bulk, in order to save money.  She will sell the products to her clients, who, when asking her advice, become potential buyers.  Looking forward, Genny hopes to make her salons more comfortable.  With that, she hopes to open a salon on one siD. of her home, which she plans to buy.  Towards this end, she and her husband are directing all of their effort.

loans.use: To purchase hair care products

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto esposo Artemio de 55 años y sus 3 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Domitila se dedica, es el cultivo de café y plátano. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en Pichanaki, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que  fumigar sus tierras, ya que los químicos perjudiquen su salud. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para retejer y mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en: Domitila is 53 years old and mother of a very happy and hard-working family.  She lives in her own home alongside her husband Artemio who is 55 years old and their 3 youngest children whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life to.  Domitila works as a farmer of coffee and bananas.  Everyday from very early in the morning she is cultivating, since she knows that the money she gets from her products depends heavily on the quality of her harvest.  She sells her product in Pichanaki, place where she is offered the best prices.  She likes harvest the most about her job since at this time she feels the months of work paying off.  She has been at it for 4 years in this activity and considers fumigating the land the most difficult, since the chemicals affect her health.  In the future she hopes to purchase new land in order to increase production.  This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she feels this contribution will help her greatly in moving forward with her work.  She is very appreciated by the rest of her partners in the communal bank since she is very supportive of them.  With the 1,500 Nuevos Soles requested, she will buy compost and fertilizers in order to rework and improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: to purchase bags of compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adela Maria

texts.es: Adela Maria tiene su negocio que es la venta de rosquillas, cacao, semilla de jícaro. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos, por lo que ha sido muy satisfactorio para su negocio. Con mucho esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante en su actividad, pues conoce a sus clientes muy bien y se encuentra muy contenta con su medio de vida. En las afueras de vivienda, se encuentra ubicado su negocio a orillas de la carretera. Este financiamiento es para la compra de rosquillas, cacao, dulces, pinol, semilla de jícaro, bolsas entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Adela Maria has a business selling donuts, cacao, and “semilla de jícaro” (a cold beverage made with milk, sugar, rice, and spices). This is not the first time that she has requested loans since they have been satisfactory for her business. With great effort, Adela was able to move forward with her activities. She knows her customers very well and is pleased to earn her livelihood in this manner. Her business is located outside of her home, next to the highway.

This loan will be used to purchase donuts, cacao, candy, “pinolillo” (a beverage made of corn and cacao), “semilla de jícaro”, bags, and other products.

loans.use: To purchase donuts, cacao, candy, “pinolillo”, “semilla de jícaro”, bags, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase school materials for her students.

loans.name: Emprendedores Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es: Gumersinda  P. D. 40 años D. edad pertenece al grupo comunal Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo, un grupo conformado por 7 integrantes las cuales son todas mujeres con gran empeño por salir adelante y surgir hacia una economía más estable para ellas y sus familias, tal es así el caso D. la señora Gumersinda P. D. 40 años D. edad conviviente y madre D. 6 hijos D. los cuales 3 aun son menores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. Remedios Naturales hace mas D. 16 años, y comienza en este trabajo por consejo D. una amiga. Con el esfuerzo D. sus trabajo a podido comprar muebles para la casa y darles una educación a sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en incrementar el negocio en compras D. más productos naturales. En el futuro le gustaría poder ampliar su negocio para así generar mayores ingresos económicos para ella y el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Gumercinda P., 40, belongs to the Emprededoras Del Valle ("Entrepreneurs of the Valley") communal bank. This group is maD. up of seven members - all women - who share a strong commitment to getting ahead and striving towards a more stable economic situation for themselves and their families.

Such is the case with Ms. Gumercinda P.. She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and the mother of six children, three of whom are still minors. She has been selling natural remedies for over 16 years and got started in this work based on a friend's advice. Thanks to her efforts at work, she has been able to buy furniture for her house and to proviD. her children with an education. She will use this loan to invest in growing her business by purchasing more natural products to sell. In the future, she would like to be able to expand her business in order to generate more income towards her and her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies

loans.name: Ines Milagros

texts.es:
Ines nació en la provincia D. Convención del departamento del Cusco y tiene 38 años D. edad. Actualmente, Ines vive en hermosa ciudad Imperial D. los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a sus tres hijos, ella tiene un club nutricional que funciona en su domicilio. En el club nutricional se sirve desayunos saludables utilizando los productos D. “Herbalife”. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ines en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos D. “Herbalife”. 

Ines es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Ines was born in Convención, Cusco, Peru.  She is 38 years old and is a very responsible person.  Currently, Ines lives in the beautiful imperial Incan city, Cusco.  She is an enterprising woman that provides for her three kids.  She runs a health club that meets in her home.  In the health club, healthy breakfasts are served that incorporate “Herbalife” products.  She has ran this business for a year and it is going very well.  

She is a member of the communal bank “Suma Purisisun” of the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Ines is requesting the loan to purchase more “Herbalife” products.

loans.use: To purchase more products.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela, de 24 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive sola en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo de secretaria que realiza Gabriela, le ha ayudado mucho a mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que los largos días de trabajo que en la empresa de transportes donde labora, le generan los ingresos económicos que necesita, para cubrir sus gastos. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que le ha sido muy rentable en estos últimos meses. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar su labor, ya que sus jefes confían en las decisiones que toma, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su oficina. Con el tiempo, desea seguir trabajando muy duro, ya que siente que todavía es muy joven y tiene mucho camino por recorrer. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy decidida a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria con las demás socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza para así tener más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 24 year old, happy hard working girl.  She lives in her own home and her greatest wish is to improve her quality of life.  She works as a secretary, which has been a large help in improving her quality of life.  She works long hours for a transportation company which helps cover her economic needs and expenses.  

She has a second job selling beauty products, which has been very profitable in recent months.  She especially enjoys the freedom to work how she wishes, because her supervisors trust the decisions she makes.  She has been doing this for two years and considers the most difficult aspect to be the obligation to stay in her office all day.  Looking forward, she wishes to continue working very hard, given that she feels that she is still young and will have many opportunities yet to come. 

This will be her third loan from MFP.  She is very committed to making her payments on time, as she will want to request other loans in the future.   She is very participative in her communal bank and is close with the other members.  

She plans to use the loan to buy more beauty product so that she can offer more products to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga nació en el distrito San Salvador y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Dominga vive en hermosa ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos de las cuales dos ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella lleva sus animales a vender a la ciudad de puerto Maldonado donde no hay mucho de estos productos y se vende como pan caliente. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Dominga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y gallinas de buena calidad. 

Dominga es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Dominga was born in the San Salvador district and is 38 years old.  She lives in the beautiful imperial city of the Incas (Cusco, Perú) and is an enterprising woman who has raised four children, two of whom are independent.  She sells small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens, for a living.

She takes them to the port city of Maldonado where this type of product is not in abundance and so she sells them like hotcakes.  She has been in business for a year and it going well for her.

Dominga needs a loan to buy quality guinea pigs and hens.  She is a responsible person and member of the "Sumac Purisisun" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy quality guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children; two of the children attend school while one is still too young for school. Elizabeth owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past year, Elizabeth has operated a dry fish selling business; she sells at retail to hotel operators and her neighbours. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of delayed payments by debtors. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Elizabeth plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase sacks of dry fish and to establish a restaurant business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of dry fish and to establish a restaurant business.

loans.name: Oslan

texts.es: Oslan Chávez de 21 años tiene en Ciudad Bicentenario un taller de soldadura llamado los Hermanos Chávez, que genera ingresos para su familia; él Inicio su negocio desde que llegó a Cartagena procedente del Sur de Bolívar donde fue desplazado con su padres a quien tiene  su  cargo;  en la linda ciudad amurallada o Cartagena de Indias, Oslan ha logrado con el apoyo de organizaciones como la Fundación Santo Domingo volver a soñar;   allí se capacitaron todos en la familia  en el oficio de soldadura y crearon su negocio llamado los Hermanos Chávez, actividad de la cual se están generando los ingresos de su hogar. Su sueño es fortalecerla,  para que muchos familiares tengan ingresos y seguir fortaleciendo la empresa familiar. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materia prima para la elaboración de carretas, rejas, puertas y artículos relacionados con la herrería.  Su mayor desafío es lograr condicionar instalaciones locativas de mayor amplitud para seguir creciendo, pero para iniciar está dirigiendo todos sus esfuerzos en función de este propósito.
texts.en:
Oslan Chávez is 21 years old and has a welding shop called Hermanos Chávez in Ciudad Bicentenario.  He generates an income for his family through the business he set up when he arrived in Cartagena from Sur de Bolívar with his parents, who are dependent on him.  In the beautiful walled city of Cartagena de Indias, and with the help of the Santo Domingo Foundation, Oslan has been able to dream again of a future.  His entire family learned the welding trade and began business as Hermanos Chávez as a means of income to cover household expenses.

His dream is to expand the business to increase earnings and stengthen the family company.  This is his first CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He plans to use it to buy raw materials to make carts, railing, doors and blacksmith-related items.

His biggest challenge is to have a large enough location in which to continue growing, but for now he is directing his efforts toward that goal for the future.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make carts, railing, doors and blacksmith-related items

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es: Gricelda tiene 43 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edmundo de 63 años y sus 6 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los largos días de trabajo que tiene Gricelda en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora de la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desde que era niña, lleva 11 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Pichanaki. Con el tiempo, espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono y fertilizantes, para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gricelda, 43, is a cheerful, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Edmundo, 63, and their six minor children who are the reason behind all her efforts.

The long hours Gricelda spends in her fields have turned her into a very knowledgeable farmer.  Her crops are very well taken care of and she always gets good prices when she sells her products.  What she enjoys the most is cultivating the soil because this is the activity she’s done since she was a little girl.  She’s been in this line of work for 11 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be transporting the products all the way to the Pichanaki market.  In time, she hopes to buy more land to increase production.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is saving up to make her payments on time because she does not want to cause any problems for her fellow communal bank members where she feels very happy.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy fertilizer and manure to make her fields more productive.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dried fish business.  She sells from home to her local neighbors. She sells foodstuff and dried fish. Sauda faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase dried fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of few legal requirements.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for sale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old, married, and has 3 children, aged 12, 11 and 3.  She has a rice farming business which has been running for 6 years. She sells her harvest to the market. Teresita also makes "halo-halo" (a shaved ice mixed with milk and fruits) which she sells to her neighborhood.

Teresita's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí se dedica a una actividad es una pulpería. Tiene 5 años de tener este negocio. Noemi tiene 2 hijos menores que estudian en un colegio público. Ella y su esposo con la ayuda de sus hijos trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos básicos, detergentes, jugos, refrescos, galletas entre otros. Sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noemí runs a grocery store for a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  Noemí has two minor children who go the public school.  She and her husband work Monday through Friday from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m., with the help of their children.

The loan is to buy sweets, softdrinks, bread, basic grains, detergent, juices, cookies, etc.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweets, softdrinks, bread, basic grains, detergent, juices, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Marina nació en la histórica ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Marina vive en misma ciudad donde nació, ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos de las cuales dos ya son independientes, ella trabaja en al PRONEI (Programa Nacional de Educación Inicial) en el área de nutrición donde se encarga de controlar la calidad de comida que sirven a los niños pero ella también se dedica en sus horas libres a enviar pasteles y tortas a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, el envió de los productos lo hace  en paquetes especiales para que no se estropeen las tortas y pasteles. Ya son 6 meses que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Marina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio pues ahora va utilizar el dinero pagar el costo del envio de tortas a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. 

Marina es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Marina was born in the historic city of Cusco and is 41 years old.  She currently lives in the same city and is a very enterprising woman who has raised four children, two of whom are independent.  She works for PRONEI (National Program for Beginning Education) in the nutrition area and supervises the quality of meals served to the children.  

In her free time she sends pastries and cakes to the city of Puerto Maldonado.  She sends the products in special packaging so the cakes and pastries do not arrive damaged.  She has been in business for six months and it is going well.  

Marina needs a loan to increase her working capital.  She plans to use the loan to pay for shipping costs to send the cakes to Puerto Maldonado.

She is a responsible person and a member of the "Sumac Purisisun" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To pay for shipping costs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert A. E. is thirty-seven years old and married. His wife is a businesswoman and they have three children, aged between ten and two years old. 

Robert's business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega.  Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya. It is a rich agricultural area known for production of sugarcane, and commonly known as the sugar belt region. He sells cereals, which include maize, beans and peas, to the local people. He has been in business for four years now. Robert says that this business is profitable and that the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 to purchase more maize and beans to grow his business. He hopes to grow his business into wholesale and in the future purchase a plot of land where he will put up a residential house. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with one child who is still young for school. Her husband is a lab technician and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Nuru dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase construction materials to build her house. Nuru decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients to make tamales and special foods

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. A. is a 49-year-old mother of three children ranging in age from 10 to 18 whom she and her husband, a farmer, hope to educate to the university level.

Rose's business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega, a rich agricultural area in the western region of Kenya known for its production of sugarcane. For three years now, she has sold cereals, including maize, beans and peas, to the local people. Rose, who works very hard to keep her business doing well, says the business is profitable, but she is faced with the major challenge of financial constraints. She will use her loan of 15,000 to purchase more maize and beans to grow her business.

Describing herself as a visionary lady, Rose hopes to develop her business into a wholesale operation and in the future purchase a plot of land where she will put up rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for her business

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Sandary K., who is in her mid-forties, is married with five children. She has been operating a food vendor business for four years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. (only seven hours) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sandary's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business and to pay school fees and bus fare for her children. She has repaid her loans successfully. Sandary hopes for a loan to open a small shop and to start selling wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, groundnuts and sugar. Her dream is to one day open a stationery shop.

Sandary will share this loan with her loan group "Crane", which consists of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the photo, Sandary is in front in an orange dress.

loans.use: to open a small shop and start selling wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, groundnuts and sugar

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
MwanaJ. is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For over one year, she has operated a tailoring business and also sells clothes from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

MwanaJ. faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase materials for her tailoring business. She dreams of expanding, and supplying clothes in large scale to meet her customers' needs. MwanaJ. decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie, 50 years old, is a married woman from San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has 2 children, aged 21 and 10 years old.

Vergie is a farmer who has been growing rice for 6 years. She earns an income by selling her harvest to the market. Vergie also raises chickens. She works hard to support her family. Vergie's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Vergie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es: Un grupo con muchos deseos D. superación y entusiasmo por lograr éxitos económicos, así se caracteriza la Alcancía Comunal El Edén conformado por  nueve integrantes hace ya más D. 3 años, los cuales se dedican a diversos negocios económicos. Muestra D. ello es el señor Juan miguel C. D. 39 años casado y padre D. dos hijos a un menores D. edad, él como todos los días se dedica a la atención en la librería bazar que tiene como negocio, a su vez también es técnico electrónico y tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, el cual le genera ingresos extras y así poder tener mayores ingresos. El comienza en este negocio a raíz que no había  ninguna librería cerca a un colegio por la zona en la que vive. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo a podido sacar adelante a su familia y brindarle una educación adecuada a sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en compras D. útiles escolares y en el futuro tiene planeado ampliar más su librería para a si obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: A group with much desire to overcome and enthusiasm to achieve economic success, this is how the Alcancía Comunal El Edén communal bank is characterized. For more than 3 years now, the group has been maD. up of 9 members that dedicate themselves to various businesses. For example, 39-year-old Juan Miguel C., who is married and the father of two children who are still minors. Every day he takes care of the book and stationary supply store that is his business. He is also an electronics technician and has a small workshop in his home, which generates extra income and allows him to have more income. He started in this business because there was not any bookstore near the school in the area where he lived. With the effort of his work, he has been able to get his family ahead and proviD. an adequate education for his children. With the recent loan, he plans to invest it in school supplies, and in the future he plans to expand his bookstore in order to obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy school supplies to stock his store

loans.name: Yamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Yamileth Del Carmen de 51años, es una mujer sincera. Por más de 7 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella  vende ropa usada casual, vestidos, trajes, pantalones de vestir. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, solo que en esta temporada sus ventas han sido pocas. Por ello, no se provee de muchas mercaderías solo compra de acuerdo al pedido que le hacen sus clientes y, de ese modo no se acumula mercaderías mucho tiempo, sin rotarlas. Está convencida que a trabajando arduamente, en adelante desea proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. Con el dinero del crédito que solicita, comprará algunos pedidos de pantalones, faldas, vestidos, trajes, camisas, entre otros.
texts.en: 51-year-old Yamileth Del Carmen is a sincere woman. For over 7 years, she has sold clothing. She sells casual used clothing, dresses, suits and dress pants. She likes her business a lot - the only problem is that this season her sales have been few. Because of this, she does not supply much merchandise, just according to what her cutomers order and, in this way, she does not accumulate much merchandise for a long time without rotating it. She is convinced that by working ardently, in the future she wants to provide her family with the necessary income. With the credit that she is seeking, she will purchase some orders of pants, skirts, dresses, suits and shirts, among others.

loans.use: to purchase some orders of pants, skirts, dresses, suits and shirts, among others

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta is a 50-year-old married woman with 3 children, the oldest 24 years old. Vicenta is in the business of hog-fattening. She sells the pigs that she fattens to the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase more piglets and feed. In the future, Vicenta would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Luis Espinal Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUIS ESPINAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de V. Adela.  Está compuesta por catorce integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Luisa.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: inicio de peluquería, venta de carne de cordero, tejido de mantas, macramé y mantas, costura, venta de calzados, costura de chamarras, tejido en cola de rata, venta de lanas, venta de carne de res, venta de medicamentos.

La señora Luisa, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer y que ingresar a la institución le invitaron los jóvenes de promoción de la institución

En la actualidad la señora Luisa tiene un negocio de venta de medicamentos (TIENS), nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga que le esta enseñando a trabajar con estos productos medicinales. El crédito que sacará ahora es para  comprar estos medicamentos, que los comprará de la oficina de (TIENS) del El Alto, luego, para venderlos, ella ambulara, porque ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, porque ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la atención.

En la foto podemos observar que tres personas no se las puede ver, ellas son la señora Ana, Máxima y Silvia, ya que no pudieron ubicarse adecuadamente.
texts.en:
The 'Luis Espinal' community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the V. Adela regional office.  This group has 14 members and its president is Luisa.  The businesses that the bank's members are engaged in are varied and include: setting up a hairdressing salon, selling lamb, knitting blankets, macramé and blankets, sewing, selling footwear, sewing jackets, weaving with satin cord, selling wool, selling beef and selling medicines.

Luisa, the bank's president, tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She was invited to join by the institution's young promoters.

Luisa currently has a business selling Tiens-brand medicines.  She tells us that she learned the business from a friend who is teaching her to work with these medicinal products.  Luisa will use her loan to buy medicines from the Tiens office in El Alto.  She will then sell them as an itinerant street vendor because she doesn't have a fixed sales location.

This work allows Luisa to make money to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When we asked Luisa what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the services.

In the photo, we can see that three people are missing: Ana, Maxima and Silvia.  This is because they couldn't fit in properly.

loans.use: to buy Tiens-brand medicines

loans.name: Green Apple Group

texts.en:
Mariam J., who is in her late thirties, is married with three children who all attend school. She has operated a fruit and vegetable business for three years. Mariam works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. Her dream is to one day open a wholesale shop for selling sodas only.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Green Apple", which consists of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Mariam is in the bottom row on the right, wearing a blue and white scarf.

loans.use: to buy more items for her stock

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a 42-year-old fish seller living in Baclayon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman and Estela helps operate their fishing business. She sells her husband's catch to the community. She is requesting a loan to purchase fishing hooks and nets, which will help them have more fish to sell. Estela has 11 children. She works hard to support them.

loans.use: to purchase fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Adama I. K., 34, is married to a teacher, and the couple has five children. Adama has been a businesswoman for ten years now, selling fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc. She is also the leader of the Tawopaneh Group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.

The Tawopaneh Group is comprised of five local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 2,500,000 SLL, with 500,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

With the help of this loan, Adama will buy fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy fish, rice, vegetable oil, margerine, salt, etc.in bulk for her business

loans.name: Asociación Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es: Empeño, esfuerzo y dedicación es lo que caracteriza a la alcancía comunal Asociación Las Tres Estrellas un grupo integrado por siete miembros el cual se dedican a diversos negocios, cada integrante cuenta con una historia en particular de dedicación y de lucha constante por salir  adelante, muestra de ello es el señor Carlos Alberto de 40 años de edad conviviente y con dos hijos en edad escolar. El señor Carlos Alberto se dedica diaria mente a la venta de periódicos desde muy temprano para así poder llevar la información a primera hora, desde su puesto de periódico llamado “El Canillita” trabaja con gran motivación para generar ganancias económicas que satisfaga las necesidades de él y de su familia. El señor Carlos Alberto comienza en este negocio hace más de 6 años y lo hace por iniciativa de su hermana que anterior mente tenía este puesto a su cargo. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo a podido comprar mueble para su hogar y brindarle la educación requerida a sus hijos. En el futuro le gustaría poder ampliar más su puesto de periódicos para a si generar mayores ganancias. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de accesorios de venta para el público como revistas y libros educativos.
texts.en:
Determination, effort and commitment are what characterize the 'Asociación Las Tres Estrellas' (The Three Stars Association) community bank.  This is a group with seven members who work in different businesses.  Each member has their own private story of a constant struggle to get ahead in life.

One example is 40 year-old Carlos Alberto who lives with his partner and has two school-age children.  Carlos Alberto sells newspapers every day.  He makes his sales from very early in the morning so that he can bring people their news first thing.  He has a newspaper stand called "El Canillita" and he works with a great deal of motivation to make profits which will cover his own needs and those of his family.  

Carlos Alberto started out in this business more than six years ago.  The initiative was his sister's as she ran the stall before him.  Through his work and effort, Carlos Alberto has been able to buy furniture for his household and provide his children with the education they need.  In the future, he would like to further expand his newspaper stand so that he can make more profit.  He will invest this loan in buying items to sell to the public such as magazines and educational books.

loans.use: to buy magazines and educational books

loans.name: San Miguel Arcangel Group

texts.es:
Marina, 25 años D. edad, casada, 2 hijos. Integra como secretaria el grupo comunal: "San Miguel Arcangel".
Marina vive en el distrito D. Chupaca barrio Pincha en Huancayo, en donD. tiene una pequeña Juguerìa que atienD. D. lunes a domingo. En el futuro a Marina le gustarìa abrir una fuente D. soda en un lugar màs concurrido.
El prèstamo solicitado es para la compra D. utensilios para la juguerìa.
En la fotografìa Marina es la D. la foto pequeña que esta en la parte superior izquierda y no estuvo presente en la reuniòn por encontrarse atendiendo su juguerìa.
El socio Cristian P. no pudo llegar a la reuniòn por encontrarse trabajando: es taxista.
texts.en:
Marina is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  She is the secretary of the 'San Miguel Arcangel' (Saint Michael the Archangel) community bank.

Marina lives in Pincha neighborhood, in Huancayo, in Chupaca district.  She has a small juice bar where she works from Monday to Sunday.  In the future, she would like to open a soda fountain in a busier location.

In the picture, Marina is the woman in the small photo in the top left-hand corner.  She wasn't present at the meeting because she was working in her juice bar.

Cristian P. couldn't attend the meeting because he was working: he is a taxi driver.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her juice bar

loans.name: Sulait

texts.en:
Sulait is a hardworking 28 year old man who needs a loan to buy Maize for resale.  He hails from Kyenjojo Uganda and he is a married man with one child who is 2 years old.  He dreams of acquiring land to set up a good livestock farm and of educating his children.

He sold a cow that was given to him by his grandfather to start the maize selling business that he is dealing in today.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 40 years old and married with two children.  He operates a cafeteria to earn a living.  He has been in the business for only one year.  He has a lot of hope for the business.  He sees himself opening a big hotel and a butcher shop in the future.   

Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to his business because he was able to get capital to start his business.  He has requested another loan of 60,000 Kes to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando nació en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Actualmente, Fernando vive en misma ciudad donde nació, él es una padre trabajador que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos, el es guía de turismo y trabaja en la agencia “Chaska Travel”. La agencia ofrece servicio de turismo por el Valle Sagrado de los Incas, Ciudadela de Machupicchu y Valle Sur. Ya son 15 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Fernando en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar la oficina de la agencia de viaje y desea comprar equipos de camping, carpas, utensilios y otras cosas más.
 
Fernando es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Fernando was born in the charming city of Cusco and he is 41 years old.  He currently lives in the same city in which he was born.  He is a hard-working father who gets his four children ahead in life.

Fernando is a tourist guide.  He works in the "Chaska Travel" agency.  The agency offers tourist services for the Sacred Valley of the Incas, the Citadel of Machu Picchu and the Southern Valley.  Fernando has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, he requires a loan to equip the travel agency office.  He would like to buy camping equipment, tents, utensils and other items.

Fernando is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa's 'Sumac Purisisun' community bank which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy camping equipment, tents, utensils and other items

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar  O. C.  de 57 años es un hombre que  vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de  Bolívar con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos que  están en las edades de 32 a 35 años   que en la actualidad viven de manera independiente, lograron estudiar y están casados. Julio Cesar inició su negocio   debido a que no encontró un empleo formal que le permitiera   generar ingresos, fue así como  vio la oportunidad de negocio,  en la venta de minutos, celulares, accesorios  y  en un principio también se dedicó al  comercio de productos agrícolas. Su meta en la actualidad es ampliar las ventas de minutos  e invertir en compra de celulares porque muchos clientes se quieren modernizar; mientras Julio Cesar sigue en su paraguas ofreciendo el servicio de telecomunicaciones, que le proporciona un porcentaje de ventas no inferior a un 29%. Está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo, con el comprará celulares y accesorios que tiene encargados.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar O. C. is 57 years old.  He lives with his wife in San Jacinto, in Bolívar department.  He has three children, aged between 32 and 35, who live independently.  They all managed to complete their education and are married.

Julio Cesar started his business because he couldn't find a formal job that would allow him to make income.  He saw a business opportunity selling cell phones, minutes and accessories.  In the beginning he also sold agricultural products.

Julio Cesar's current goal is to expand his sales of minutes and to invest in buying cell phones because a lot of customers want to upgrade.  In the meantime, Julio Cesar continues offering his telecommunications service which makes him a sales percentage of at least 29%.  He is applying for a Kiva loan (his first through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo) because he would like to expand his working capital.  He will use it to buy cell phones and accessories that he has ordered.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories that he has ordered

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Bless” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs seeking a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each to invest in their business. 

Aminata K. is the leader of this group. Aminata is 36 years old, and married with two children who both attend primary school. Aminata sells slippers, rubber bowls, dishes, and other items. She has been running this business for fifteen years. With the help of this loan, Aminata will buy items in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, rubber bowls, dishes, and other items in bulk

loans.name: Pharis

texts.en: Pharis is a hardworking businessman who sells vehicle spare parts. He is 32 years old, married and blessed with a two-year-old child. He has been running his business for ten years. He has saved his money with a group in Faulu Kenya. In the group, he is able to access loans easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loans. He has requested 60,000 Kes to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Las Misioneras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MISIONERAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada.  Está compuesta por doce integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Ana.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Ana, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la primera vez que participa en Pro Mujer, se integro a la institución por la invitaron las compañeras de la asociación las misioneras.

En la actualidad la señora Ana tiene un negocio de hilandería de lana de vicuña y elabora mantas, nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su cuñada hace 18 años. El crédito que sacará ahora es para  aumentar su capital (comprar mas lana), que comprará de la feria 16 de julio (zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto), luego lo venderá a crédio.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, porque ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.
