ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa (shots, pantalones, blusas, camisas, playeras, clasetines, ropa interior)y perfumes para dama y caballero para su porterior venta. ella desea que con esta inversion las ganancias aumenten ya que desea que su hijo el mas pequeño regrese a la escuela y seguir invirtiendo porque espera que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Carmen is 40 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Esteban who works as a police officer. They have two children who work and help with the household expenses.

Carmen says, “During these bad economic times, a woman should not stay at home but try to earn some money.” She indicates that she started out selling gold, but since it is expensive, she was not able to generate good earnings. Carmen switched to selling clothing and perfumes. She sells to her friends and neighbors by going house to house.

Carmen needs this loan to invest in the purchase of clothing such as shorts, trousers, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, socks, and undergarments. She will also acquire perfumes for women and men to sell later. Carmen hopes that this investment will increase her earnings because she desires for her youngest son to return to school. She wants to continue investing so that her business will prosper.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and perfumes.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
la señora Jackeline es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual significa novia del del sol, la cual es una region ganadera. doña Jacky(como ña llaman sus vecinos) tiene la edad de 26 años, estudio solo la primaria y esta casada con el señor alfredo con el cual tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres  de nombres karina de 8 años que asiste a la primaria, cristel de 2 años y un hombre llamado alfredo de 4 años que asiste al prescolar.

Ella nos platica hace mas de cuatro años tuvo la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y lo platico con su el, cuando tuvieron un poco de dinero ahorrado desidieron invertirlo en la compra de mesas y sillas para rentarlas, nos platica que inicio rentando sus sillas a sus vecinos para las fiestas pero con el tiempo ha hecho mas clientes. ella brinda el servicio de renta y las lleva a domicilio y las va a recoger despues del evento. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de mas sillas, mesas y algunos manteles  ya que nos dice que en algunas ocasiones hay varios eventos y no le alcanzan las sillas para cubrir todos los pedidos.	 

ella esperera que con esta inversion su negocio cresca y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus cliente  porque nos dice "cuando se da un buen sericio el cliente vuelve y no solo vuelve sino que te recomienda eso es lo que ayuda a crecer"

Tambien dijo" no todo lo he logrado sola tambien debo agradecer a mi esposo y a la fundacion porque ellos me han dado el apoyo economico para que mi negocio cresca"
texts.en:
Sra. Jackeline is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Jacky (as she is called by her neighbors) is 26 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Alfredo and they have three children, two daughters named Karina (an 8 year old elementary school student) and Cristel (age 2) as well as a son named Alfredo (a 4 year old pre-school student).

More than four years ago, Jacky decided to start working so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. After talking with each other, they decided to save some money so that she could invest in the purchase of tables and chairs to rent. Jacky says that she started renting chairs to her neighbors for parties, and over time she was able to acquire more customers. She manages her rental business from her home and the items are returned after the event.

Jacky needs this loan to invest in the purchase of more chairs, tables, and a few tablecloths. She says that there are a few occasions when she has several events booked but does not have enough chairs to cover all of her requests.

Jacky hopes that this investment will grow her business and help her provide better service to her customers because she says, “When I provide good service, not only do my clients return, but they also provide recommendations that help my business grow.”

She also says, “I haven’t been able to do everything by myself. I also have to thank my husband and Fundación Realidad for the financial support they have provided for making my business grow.”

loans.use: To purchase tables and chairs for events.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Veronica es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares dnde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz.Doña Veronica tiene la edad de 27 años estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor german el cual trabaja de herrero y albañil. ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 son mujeres y uno es hombre. 

Doña veronica nos platica que ella desea iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que desea ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella desea inicia a a vender abarrotes desde su hogar con sus amigos y vecionos.

ella tiene pensado invertir su credito en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para surtir su negocio. 

ella nos dice que en su casa tiene un pequeño local en el cual piensa poner su negocio, tambien nos comenta que ella espera que su negocio le deje buenas ganancias para seguir invirtiendo y que su negocio cresca ya que desea darle estudios a sus pequeños y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Veronica is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Veronica is 27 years old and has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. German, who works as a blacksmith and mason. They have four children, three daughters and one son.

Doña Veronica says she wanted to start her own business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s studies. She began selling groceries out of her home to friends and neighbors.

Veronica plans to invest her loan in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, candy, coffee, cookies, juices, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, toilet paper, and canned peppers to restock her business. She says that she has a small space in her home where she operates her business. Veronica says that she hopes to generate good earnings so that she can continue investing in her business to make it grow, provide for her children’s education, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Emilia es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares donde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz.  Doña Emilia tiene la edad de 49 años, solo estudio la primaria y se encuentra casada con el señor Bernardo el cual trabaja como albañil, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente solo vive con su esposo .

Doña emilia nos platica que hace mas de 8 años ella y su esposo juntaron sus ahorros para poder poner una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes la cual lleva el nombre de "abarrotes la esquinita".

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, sopa, jabon, pasta dental, refrescos, dulces, cafe, galletas, jugos, veladoras, crema, queso, tomates, chiles, cebolla, papel higienicas y chiles enlatados para resurtir su negocio. 

Ella nos dice "a mi me gusta tener un poquito de todo en mi tienda para no perder clientes y siempre que vengan a comprar encuentren lo que busquen ademas de dar un buen servio"

ella espera tener buenas ganancias ya que desa seguir invirtiendo para que su negocio cresca cada dia
texts.en:
Doña Emilia is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Emilia is 49 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Bernardo, who works as a mason, and has four children who are already married. At the moment, she and her husband live by themselves.

Doña Emilia says that she and her husband used their savings to start a small grocery store called “Abarrotes La Esquinita” (The Corner Grocery). She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, soup, soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, candy, coffee, cookies, juices, candles, cream, cheese, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, toilet paper, and canned peppers to restock her business.

Emilia says, “I like to have a little bit of everything in my store so that I won’t lose customers. They always come to shop because they can find everything and I provide them good service.” She hopes to generate good revenues so that she can continue investing in her business and grow each day.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Flor Mechoacan Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor Mechoacan llamado así porque los integrantes pertenecen a esta localidad llamada así y flor porque todas las integrantes son mujeres, es por ello que se llama así porque ellas son las flores de Mechoacan. Es una población de gente indígena mixteco que trabaja día con día para obtener dinero para mantener a sus familias.
La señora Patricia Hernández M. es la representante de este grupo, esta casada con el señor Abel quien se dedica a las labores del campo, tiene 2 hijos que estudian. Ella solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración  de comida ya que ella se dedica a la venta de tacos de res y tacos dorados de pollo y chorizo. Además de ese negocio ella tiene una pequeña miscelánea que de igual manera le ayuda a solventar los gastos de su familia. Su meta de Patricia es engrandecer su miscelánea y que sus pequeños sigan estudiando y tengan una mejor preparación.
Marcelina Hernández Q. es otra de las integrantes del grupo una mujer admirable que siempre a trabajado para sacar a sus hijos adelante después de que se quedo viuda. Ella se dedica a  la venta de tostadas ahí en su comunidad, solicitó el préstamo para poder comprar mas insumos para la elaboración de sus tostadas, además de las ventas de tostadas ella también se dedica a la elaboración de comal (herramienta de barro que se utiliza para la elaboración de tortillas echas a mano).
Marcelina trabaja todos lo días para mantener a sus hijos, darles alimentación y educación, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y la ayudan con los gastos y los 3 mas pequeños estudian.
Su sueño de doña Marcelina es poderles darle una buena educación a sus hijos y que tengan un profesión para que el día de mañana tengan mejores oportunidades y no sufran de las carencias como las que viven ahora. 
La mayoría de las personas que integran este grupo se dedican a la venta de antojitos como son tacos y tostadas, y solo una se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
This group is called “Flor Mechoacan” because the members are from the town of Mechoacan.  The word “flor” (flower) was chosen since all the members are women, which explains the name “Flor Mechoacan”.  This community has a population consisting of indigenous people of Mixtec descent who work day after day so that they can earn money to support their families.

Sra. Patricia Hernández M. is the group representative.  She is married to Sr. Abel, who is a field laborer.  They have two children in school.  Patricia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing food.  She sells beef tacos and golden tacos with chicken and chorizo sausage.  In addition to this business, she also has a small variety store that helps to cover her family’s expenses.  Patricia’s goal is to expand her variety store so that her children can continue to study and be better prepared.  

Marcelina Hernández Q. is another member of the group.  She is an admirable woman who has been constantly working after she became widowed so that her children can stay ahead.  Marcelina sells tostadas in her community.  She is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for making tostadas.  In addition to selling tostadas, she also manufactures “comals” (traditional griddles made of clay used for making tortillas by hand).  

Marcelina works every day to support her children, as well as feed and educate them.  She has five children altogether, two of whom work and help with the expenses while the three younger ones are in school.  Her dream is to provide her children with a good education so that they can pursue careers that will give them better opportunities in the future and not have to endure the struggles they are facing now.  

Most of the members in this group sell snacks such as tacos and tostadas.  Only one member sells household products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for tacos, such as chicken and chorizo.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares dnde hace mas calor del estado de Veracruz. Milagros tiene la edad de 24 años solo estudio la preparatoria y es madre soltera de una niña de 9 meses de nombre judith.

ella nos platica que antes de que naciera su hija trabaja en una papeleria pero desde que nacio su hija no puede salir a trabajar asi que se ha asociado con su hermana para poner una pequeña papeleria en la cual tambien venden dulces y refrescos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas, biografias, dulces y refrescos.

ella espera que sus ganancias sean buenas ya que espera en un futuro contruir un local para instalarla su papeleria .
texts.en:
Milagros is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Milagros is 24 years old and has a high school education. She is a single mother with a nine month old daughter named Judith.

Milagros says that she worked at a stationery shop before the birth of her daughter. After she was born, Milagros was not able to go to work, so she and her sister opened a small stationery store where they also sell candy and soft drinks.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pencils, pens, white and colored paper, glue, scissors, folders, bond paper, modeling clay, packing foam, craft foam, notebooks, books, prints, journals, candy, and soft drinks. Milagros hopes that her earnings are good because she hopes to build a store in the future to house her stationery shop.

loans.use: To purchase stationery, candy, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Leonarda Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel nació en la ciudad de Paruro del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 43 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca,  ella es viuda y por lo tanto es padre  madre para sus dos hijos. 

Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio y también tiene una tienda escolares en el colegio Illary de la ciudad de Anta. También se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos y gallinas.  En esta oportunidad Isabel requiere el microcrédito para comprar comida para los pollos. El sueño de Isabel es tener una granja de pollitos. 

Isabel es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in Paruro city in the department of Cusco. She is 43 years old and lives in Izcuchaca city. Isabel is a widow, and thus must act as both mother and father of her two children.

She owns a grocery store, located in her home, and also runs a store selling school supplies at the Illary secondary school in Anta city. She also raises small livestock such as guinea pigs and poultry. It is for this business that Isabel needs a microloan, to buy chicken feed. She dreams of having a poultry farm.

Isabel is a responsible person and member of the "Warmicuna Llanqanchis” community bank, which belongs to Arariwa banking association in Cusco city, Perú. “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” is Quechua for "Working Women".

loans.use: To purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: El Espacio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el espacio, uno de los integrantes sugirió este nombre para el grupo, ya que dice que en ninguna otra micro financiera le dan la oportunidad a los hombres de ingresar yaqui si, esta historia es acerca del señor Daniel L. S., (mejor conocido como don dani, ya que así le dicen sus vecinos), puesto que es el representante de esta UDE, el tiene 40 años de edad es soltero, tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 19 años.
Daniel eligió esta actividad, puesto que es lo que mejor se vende en su comunidad, también porque dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, que le ayuda para continuar apoyando la economía de su familia, el invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, leche, jabón, clara sol y papel higiénico
La meta que dice tener don dani para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que lo quiere hacer crecer, puesto que está pensando en ampliar su local, para tenerlo muy bien surtido y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, para poder continuar apoyando a su padre ya que está muy grande de edad.
Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen perfectamente y son personas muy responsables con sus pagos y sobre todo bien trabajadores.
Las personas que conforman el grupo son las siguientes: inocencia, Carmela, enelva, blanca, María, maura, Daniel, Lizbeth, Edith y Estefanía, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: abarrotes, venta de pescados, elaboración de tamales, frutería, venta de cosméticos, etc.
texts.en:
This group's name is El Espacio (The Space). One of the members suggested this name for the group, explaining that this is the only microfinance institution to give them the opportunity to join. 

This is the story of Daniel L. S. (better known as Don Dani, as his neighbors call him) since he is the representative for the development group ("UDE"). Daniel is a 40-year-old single man who has run a small grocery store for 19 years now. He chose this business because groceries are the best thing to sell in his community. He also says it's a very good source of income which allows him to continue supporting his family.

Daniel will use the loan to purchase more merchandise such as: soft drinks, rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, soap, Clarasol cleaner and toilet paper. Don Dani's goal for his store is to continue investing in it because he wants it to grow. He would like to expand his store in order to stock it well and gain more income. This will help him to continue supporting his very elderly father.

Daniel told us how well his group works together. All of the members know each other well and are very responsible when it comes to making payments. Above all, they are very hardworking individuals. The group's members are: Inocencia, Carmela, Enelva, Blanca, María, Maura, Daniel, Lizbeth, Edith and Estefanía. They all have different jobs such as: selling groceries, selling fish, making tamales, selling fruit and selling cosmetics etc.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise such as: soft drinks, rice, sugar, salt, oil, milk, soap, Clarasol cleaner and toilet paper.

loans.name: Bathishig

texts.en:
Bathishig D., 38, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Dornod province in Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband works as an officer at a military base.

Bathishig began selling foodstuffs in 2003. In the beginning, she used to operate a small kiosk, and now she operates her own food store next to her house. She is a hardworking and polite person who says, “I am planning to enlarge my store." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
En la Cuenca del Papaluapan existe una comunidad llamada Paso Rincon la cual se caracteriza por ser productora de limon, en este lugar existe la contumbre de que toda la familia trabaja en la cosecha desde los hijos hasta los padres y abuelos.

En esta comunidad vive una señora llamada Angelina P. O.  que tiene la edad de 67 años, es casada y nos platica que hace mas de diez años se dedica a la siembra y cultivo del limon ya que su esposo tiene una  pequeña parcela la cual en la cual su familia trabaja.

Ella nos platica que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio son los ratos que comprarte con su familia en el campo ya que no solo trajan sino que tambien conviven y se ganan unos pesos(dinero). ella dice "en estos tiempos sino se trajaba no se come" 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su limonal ya que desea tener una buena cosecha para que sus ganancias aumenten y segirle invirtiendo al negocio.

Doña Angelina envia un saludo a la fundacion y mucho agradecimiento por la confianza que le dio al otorgarle el prestamo.
texts.en:
In Cuenca del Papaluapan there is a neighborhood called Paso Rincon which is known for growing lemons. In this area it is traditional for the entire family, from the children to the parents and grandparents, to help with the harvest.

In this neighborhood lives Angelina P. O. , a 67-year-old married woman. She tells us she has been planting and growing lemon trees for over ten years now since her husband has a small plot where his family can grow crops.

Angelina tells us that what she likes best about her work is the time she spends with her family in the field. Not only do they work together but they also live together and earn a few pesos (money) together. She says that "these days, if we don't work, we don't eat."

She needs this loan in order to buy fertilizers and manure for her lemon trees as she would like to have a good harvest. This would help her to increase her income and continue investing in her business.

Angelina sends her best to the foundation and is very grateful for this loan.

loans.use: to grow lemons.

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira es habitante de una una comunidad llamada Paso Rinco que se encuentra en la Cuenca del Papaloapan, en esta comunidad se cracteriza por ser productora de limon y existe una tradicion la cual consiste en  que en el tiempo de cosecha toda la familia se reune para ir a trabajar en el cultivo del limon desde los abuelos hasta los nietos participan en el corte.

Doña Elvira nos platica que en su familia siempre se ha trabajado en el cultivo del limon asi que desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar el limon y ahora que ya se caso y tiene a sus hijos les esta enseñando poco a poco ya que ella piensa que ya es una tradicion familiar.

ella nos dice "el cultivo del limon es buen negocio pero como todo tiene sus altas y bajas, por eso nos prevenimos ahorrando para cuando no hay"

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para su limonal.
 
ella nos comenta "los arbolitos son como nuestros hijos debemos darles de comer y cuidarlos para que den fruto"
texts.en:
Elvira lives in a community called Paso Rincon which is located in the Cuenca del Papaloapan region. Paso Rincon is known for producing lemons. It is traditional in this area for the entire family, from the grandparents down to the grandchildren, to come together to work during the lemon harvest.

Elvira tells us that her family has always grown lemons. From the time she was little, her parents taught her to grow lemons. Now that she's married and has children of her own, she is teaching them bit by bit what she considers to be the family tradition.

She tells us that "lemon growing is a good business but like every business, it has its ups and downs. That is why we save up for times when business is slow." She needs this loan in order to buy fertilizer and manure for her lemon trees. She tells us that "the young trees are like our children. We have to feed them and take care of them until they are ready to bear fruit."

loans.use: to grow lemons.

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es habitante de una una comunidad llamada Paso Rinco que se encuentra en la Cuenca del Papaloapan, en esta comunidad se cracteriza por ser productora de limon y existe una tradicion la cual consiste en  que en el tiempo de cosecha toda la familia se reune para ir a trabajar en el cultivo del limon desde los abuelos hasta los nietos participan en el corte.

Doña leonarda nos platica que desde que ella era muy pequeña aprendio a trabajar en el cultivo del limon y cuando se caso y tuvo a sus hijos ella les enseño como trabajarlo.

ella nos dice"El cultivar el limon es bonito porque trabajamos como familia unidos y nos ganamos el pan de cada dia"

Doña leonarda no solo se dedica al cultivo del limon ella tambien tiene un pequeño molino de Nixtamal en el cual muele el maiz a sus amigos y vecionos de la comunidad, nos cuenta que tiene que levantarse todos los dias a las cinco de la mañana para iniciar a trabajar ya que esta comunidad aun se acostumbra a comer con tortillas de mano.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su limonal ademas de necesitarlo para la compra de algunas piezas y darle mantenimiento de su molino.
texts.en:
Leonarda lives in a community called Paso Rinco, which is located in Cuenca del Papaloapan. This community is known for producing limes. There is a tradition in which during harvest time, the whole family gets together to go work in the lime orchards; everyone, from the grandparents to the grandchildren, participate in the harvest.

Leonarda tells us that she learned to farm limes from the time she was very young, and when she got married and had children, she taught them to farm them, too. She tells us that “Farming limes is nice because we work together as a family to make our daily living.”

Leonarda not only farms limes, she also has a small cornmeal grinder where she grinds corn for her friends and neighbors in the community. She says that she has to get up at 5:00 every morning to begin work because in her community people still eat hand-made tortillas.

She needs this loan to buy fertilizers for her lime trees and also to buy a few replacement pieces and make some repairs to her corn grinder.

loans.use: to cultivate limes and repair her corn grinder

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la Cuenca del Papaluapan existe una comunidad llamada Paso Rincon la cual se caracteriza por ser productora de limon, en este lugar existe la costumbre de que toda la familia trabaja en la cosecha desde los hijos hasta los padres y abuelos.

La señora Rosa R. P. es una habitante de esta comunidad y  nos dice " Desde que yo me case mi esposo me enseño a trabajar en el cultivo del limon y como han hido cresiendo mis hijos se les ha enseñado, es un trabajo que me gusta mucho por dos razones una porque nos une como familia cada vez que cosechamos ya que vamos juntos a trabajar y el segundo los pesos(dinero) que ganamos con nuestro trabajo"

Ella nos platica que en hay temporadas como las de Diciembre que el limon les deja buena gancia pero tambien hay temporadas bajas para las cuales deben preparase con ahorros. 

Tambien nos dijo que ella sale a vender su limon con su esposo en el mercado de una comunidad cercana llamada Tres Valles.

Doña Rosa va invertir este credito  en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus limonal .
texts.en:
In Cuenca del Papaluapan there is a community called Paso Rincón, which is known for producing limes. In this area there exists a tradition of the whole family working in the harvest, including the children, the parents, and even the grandparents.

Rosa R. P. lives in this community and she tells us “When I got married, my husband taught me to work in lime farming, and as my children have grown, he has taught them too. I like this work very much for two reasons. The first is because it unites us as a family each time we harvest because we work together. The second reason is the money we earn from our work."

She tells us that there are high seasons, like in December, when limes bring them good earnings. However, there are also low seasons for which they must prepare with savings. 

She also tells us that she goes with her husband to sell their limes in the market of a nearby community called Tres Valles.

Rosa will use her loan to buy fertilizers for her lime trees.

loans.use: to cultivate limes

location.town: Paso Rincon, San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec, Oaxaca

loans.name: Colibri Group

texts.es:
La Señora Teresita es miembro del grupo Colibri y es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual es mas conocido como la novia del sol, ya que ademas de ser una region ganadera es uno de los lugares donde hace mas calor del estado de VeraC.. Doña Teresita tiene la edad de 45 años, estudio la carrera tecnica de secretaria la cual ejercio hasta que sus hijos nacieron.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 23 años con el apoyo de su esposo decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y abrio una pequeña papeleria a la cual llamo Papeleria Junior.

Ella nos dijo"como le dijo a mi esposo mientras existan las escuelas siempre tendremos venta, por eso a mi siempre me gusta tener surtido aunque sea un poquito de todo para que los chamacos(estudiantes- niños) siempre encuentren lo que buscan"
 
Doña teresita  necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de lapiz, lapiceros, hojas blancas y de colores, resistol, tijeras, cartilinas, papel bond, plastilina, unicel, fomy, cuadernos, libretas, laminas y biografias para resurtir su tienda.

ella nos dijo que espera con esta inversion poder aunmentar sus ganancias para poder agrandar su nagocio.

Doña vianey es otro miembro del grupo colibri, ella tiene 40 años, solo asistio a la secundaria y esta casa, ella tiene dos hijas las cuales practican danza y voleibol. 

Ella nos platica que hace mas de dos años decidio iniciar con su propio negocio de venta de pasteles, play y flan. Ella vende algunas veces por pedido y en otras ocasiones vende casa por casa, nos dice que lo que le ayuda a tener mucha venta es que tiene muchos amigos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de huevos, mantequilla, leche, moldes, gas, arina, chantilli, fruta y colorantes para la preparacion de sus pasteles y posteriormente venderlos. nos dice que le gustaria tener su propia pasteleria en un local en el centro de Tierra blanca pero tambien nos dicer que debe 
trabajar duro y ahorrar mucho para poder lograr tener su pasteleria

ella se encuentra muy contenta con este prestamo ya que le ayudara a que su negocio prospere.

Los demas personas que integran este grupo son:

Maria Luisa H. D.– venta de agus de garrafón
Irma C. Gracia – venta de cosmetico
Maria Adriana Gutierrez H.- venta de artesanias
Brenda Rosario H. C.-taller mecanico
Favi Jazmin Z. Pinmentel- venta de telefonos
Susana S. D.- venta de ropa interior
Nadia Alejandra A. P.- venta de topperWare
Ariadna Esperanza V. R.- taller de costura
Maria del Rocio P. G.- estetica
texts.en:
Teresita is a member of the “Colibrí” group and she lives in a place called Tierra Blanca, which is best known as the “Beloved of the Sun” because, in addition to being a cattle region, it is one of the hottest places in VeraC.. Teresita is 45 years old. She studied to be a secretary, which was her career until her children were born.

She tells us that a little more than 23 years ago, with the support of her husband, she decided to start her own business. She opened a small stationary store, which she called Papelería Junior. She says “Like I told my husband, as long as there are schools, we will always be able to sell. That’s why I always like to have a good amount of stock even if it’s only a little bit of each thing, so that students and children will always find what they are looking for.”

Teresita needs this loan to buy pencils, pencil cases, paper in white and other colors, glue, scissors, paper board, bond paper, modeling clay, polystyrene, foam, notebooks, spiral notebooks, laminates, and biographies, to re-stock her store.

Vianey is another member of the “Colibrí” group. She is 40 years old. She only attended junior high, and she is married. She has two daughters, both of whom practice dance and volley ball. 

She tells us that more than ten years ago, she decided to start her own business selling cakes, bread, and flan. She sometimes sells by previous order, and sometimes she sells door to door. She explains that what helps her have good sales is having many friends. 

She needs this loan to buy eggs, butter, milk, baking tins, cooking gas, flour, whipped cream, fruits, and food colorings for the preparation of her cakes. She is very happy with this loan because it will help her business to prosper.

The other members of this group are: 
Maria Luisa H. D. – bottled water sales
Irma C. Gracia – cosmetics sales
Maria Adriana Gutierrez H. - crafts sales
Brenda Rosario H. C. - mechanic shop
Favi Jazmin Z. Pinmentel - telephone sales
Susana S. D.- intimate clothing sales
Nadia Alejandra A. P. - Tupperware sales
Ariadna Esperanza V. R. - sewing shop
Maria del Rocio P. G. - cosmotology

loans.use: to buy paper, pencil cases, underwear and cell phones.

loans.name: Iderbat

texts.en:
Iderbat, 31, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they own. His wife works as a teacher and his elder son attends a local school. They have an average standard of living. 

Iderbat worked as a manual laborer in Korea for a few years. When he came back to Mongolia, he started driving a taxi. He supports his family with the money he earns. He plans to start selling cell phones in the near future in addition to his taxi service.  He is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want to begin selling cellphones in order to increase my income". He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to buy cellphones from Erlian for his new business.

loans.use: to buy cellphones to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth nació en la provincia de Cusco del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca,  ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. 

Ruth es docente y trabaja en el colegio de comunidad de Huallacocha, ella enseña en el nivel primario desde hace 11 años. Ruth también se dedica la distribución de comestibles y distribuye a tienda de abarrotes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de comestibles y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Ruth requiere el microcrédito para comprar comestibles.  El sueño de Ruth es tener una propia tienda de ventas comestibles.  

Ruth es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Ruth was born in Cusco Province in the Department of Cusco. She is 36 years old and lives in the city of Izcuchaca. Ruth is married and has four children.

She is a teacher who works at a school in the community of Huallacocha. Ruth has been teaching at the elementary level for eleven years. She also sells food products and distributes them to grocery stores. Ruth has been selling food products for many years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a microloan to buy groceries. Her dream is to open her own grocery store.

Ruth is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The phrase “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” means “Women Who Work” in the Quechua language.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bayarjavhlan

texts.en:
Bayarjavhlan, 25, is married and lives with her husband and son in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. They  live in a house provided by her husband's employer for a few years. Her husband works for a local flight company. 

Bayarjavhlan began selling clothes in 2010. She sells clothing out of a rented stall and her current inventory is valued at about 800,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her working capital in order to save money to buy an apartment. She is a hardworking and active person who says, "I want to expand my business further and have my own stall or a store and save money to buy an apartment." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: 21 De Octubre (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 21 De Octubre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por sus artesanías reconocidas a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace dos ciclos decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar el nivel de vida, ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios y artesanía, también trabajan en fabricas en la ciudad de Manta.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Guignia Esmerida R., tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y una chica de 17 años  que es la que  aun vive con ella. Su marido es albañil. 
Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa y también un bar en el que vende bocadillos y bebidas, en su tienda vende productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos, carne, pollo, pescado entre otros, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija a veces le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en Manta, aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva cinco años en la tienda y uno en su bar y que le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, bebidas y otros productos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos ciclos y fue ella la que formo este grupo en el cual está muy contenta. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante y poner un negocio en Manta.
texts.en:
The October 21st Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received national and international recognition. This is also the place where the famous Panama hats are made.

The members of the group have participated in two loan cycles. They formed this Communal Bank and are committed to staying together as long as the loans improve their standard of living. The members engage in different business activities involving trade, services, and crafts. They also have factory jobs in the city of Manta.

It is in this place that one can find Sra. Guignia Esmerida R.. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Three are grown and the youngest child is a 17 year old daughter who still lives with her. Her husband works as a mason.

Guignia has a grocery store in her home and also manages a bar where she sells snacks and beverages. In her store, she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, meat, chicken, fish, and other products. She works every day from 6am to 8pm, and sometimes much later. Her daughter occasionally helps with her business. Guignia buys her products in Manta and most of them are delivered to her store. She says that her store has been open for five years and her bar has been in existence for one year. Both businesses are doing well.

This loan will be used to increase the inventory of her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, beverages, and other products. Guignia has been with the Communal Bank for two loan cycles and was a founding member of the group. She is pleased to be part of the group.

Her goals are to move forward and open a business in Manta.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Otgontuul

texts.en: Otgontuul, 43, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2008. They used to live in the countryside and moved to Ulaanbaatar in 2008. They have an average standard of living. In 2005 Otgontuul began sewing dels, Mongolian traditional long coats. She makes the dels at home and sells them out of a rented stall at the local market. She has built a good reputation, and she gets regular custom orders. During special occasions or holidays, she generally gets more custom orders. Her business is growing, as the number of people who prefer to wear traditional clothing is increasing. She is a hardworking person who says, " I try to make much better traditional clothes and attract my customers while advertising the traditional clothing." She is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more materials to make clothing.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make Mongolian traditional coats

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana nació en la provincia de Anta del departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 53 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Izcuchaca, Anta. 

Bibiana se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en las ferias  y otras veces vende comida. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas alcohólicas y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Bibiana requiere el microcrédito para comprar más cerveza y gaseosas. El sueño de Bibiana es tener un depósito de venta de cerveza en su domicilio.   

Bibiana es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Bibiana was born in Anta Province in the Department of Cusco. She is 53 years old and lives in the city of Izcuchaca, Anta.

Bibiana sells beer and sodas at the fairs and on other occasions she sells food. She has been selling food and alcoholic beverages for many years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Bibiana is taking this opportunity to request a microloan to buy more beer and sodas. Her dream is to have a warehouse in her home where she can sell beer.

Bibiana is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The phrase “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” means “Women Who Work” in the Quechua language.

loans.use: To purchase beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Shinehuu

texts.en:
Shinehuu, 52, is divorced and lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her two older children got married and she lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in her son's backyard. 

Shinehuu came to live in Ulaanbaatar in 2009 and began operating a tailor shop. She wants to expand her business and create work places as her daughter is currently unemployed. She is a hardworking person with initiative who says, "I would like to expand my business in order to give jobs to other people including my daughter." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy additional stitching machines for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stitching machines

loans.name: Maria Eleuteria

texts.es: Doña Eleuteria vive en Tres Estrellas, en una comunidad indigena donde la mayoria de la gente es ganadera se dedica a criar y engordar animales, tambien en esta comunidad se ve mucho que los hombres emigren al extranjero a Estados Unidos en busca de un trabajo y poder mandar dinero a su familia, Doña Eleuteria nos platica que su prestamo lo pidio para poder comprar la mercancia que le hace falta; Ella nos dice " Me hace falta Huevo, pan, leche, sal, azucar, cajas de dulces, refrescos, quiero comprar un poco de todo para que la tienda tenga toda la mercancia, una dificultad en mi negocio siguen siendo las ventas, no siempre se vende como uno quiere, pero aun asi voy saliendo adelante, la mercancia la compro en un pueblo cercano para no salir tan lejos, con el prestamo voy a invertir y mi intención es sacar ganancias para poder pagar el credito y tambien que quede algo para mi, tengo la meta de salir adelante con el negocio ya que no hay de otra con la ayuda de prestamo como estos, tengo 52 años de edad, soy casada ya cumpli 30 años de estar viviendo con mi esposo, solamente un hijo depende de mi, estudia, en total tengo 7 hijos, vivo en casa propia y mi esposo trabaja como albañil.
texts.en:
Doña Eleuteria lives in “Tres Estrellas” (Three Stars), an indigenous community where most of the people engage in raising and fattening livestock. Several men from this community have migrated to the United States in search of work so that they can send money back to their families.

Doña Eluteria says she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise that she is lacking. She states, “I need eggs, bread, milk, salt, sugar, boxes of candy, and soft drinks. I want to buy a little bit of everything so that my store will be stocked with all types of merchandise.” One difficulty she faces with her business is that her sales are not always at the level that she wants, but she continues to press forward. She acquires her merchandise from a nearby town so that she does not have to travel far. With this loan, she plans to invest with the intention of earning enough to repay the loan and also have something left over for herself. Her goal is to succeed with her business since she receives no other assistance besides the loans.

Eluteria is 52 years old and has been married to her husband for thirty years. She has a total of seven children, but only one is a dependent who is in school. Her husband works as a mason and they live in their own home.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es: Doña Natalia es de una comunidad llamada tres estrellas, es una comunidad indigina, tal comunidad presenta un indice alto de personas que emigran a los Estados Unidos para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida y de su familia, el negocio que tiene doña Natalia es una papeleria y su prestamo nos comenta que lo solicito para invertir en mercancia en utilies escolares para el negocio, ella platica: " la competencia es un factor importante porque hay otra papeleria cerca de la mia y como hay otra es dificil sacar buenas ventas y tambien ganancias, la mercancia si se vende pero se vende despacio, el prestamo me ayuda mucho porque voy a tener la oportunidad de invertir el dinero en mas mercancia, nuevas libretas lapiceros, calculadores en todo lo que mas venda, y con eso lo que gano lo ocupo para la comida por ejemplo, mis metas son no quedarme como estoy y luchar por ahumentar y hacer mas grande mi negocio, tengo tres hijos por lo que tengo todavia que ver para que salgan adelante, 2 hijos estudian, tengo 35 años, 15 años de casada, vivo en casa propia, mi esposo trabaja tiene un negoci de aluminio y vidrio.
texts.en:
Doña Natalia is from the community of “Tres Estrellas” (Three Stars). This community features a high influx of people who have migrated to the United States in search of a better quality of life for their families. Doña Natalia manages a stationery business and says that her loan will be invested in school supplies. She says, “Competition is a major factor because there are other stationery shops near me, so it is difficult to generate good sales and earnings.” Her merchandise sells at a slow rate.

The loans have been a great help because they have given her the opportunity to invest in more merchandise such as books, pens, and calculators. She sells most of everything. For this reason, she is concerned about feeding her family. Her goals are to move forward and fight to expand her business. Natalia has three children who she wants to see succeed. Two of them are in school.

Natalia is 35 years old and has been married for fifteen years. She lives in her own home. Her husband has an aluminum and glass business.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell in her business.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
El señor Elodio O. vive en la comunidad de Tres estrellas, es una comunidad que poco a poco va avanzando en carretera y servicios, ya cuenta con escuelas para los niños y va mejorando la educación. 

Eladio tiene una herreria, trabaja con aluminio y vidrio para ventanas y puertas. Él desea invertir el credito para comprar herramienta nueva y tambien para conseguir mas material para poder trabajar, Eladio nos dice: "lo complicado de mi negocio es que hay mas herrerias como la mía, entonces hay menos trabajo para mi".
Él espera que el prestamo le beneficie para poder tener un mejor futuro, tener mas trabajo y y un mejor estilo de vida para su familia, comenta que entre mas competencia tenga, tiene que terminar mas rápido, para entregar su trabajo mas rápido y buscar mas clientes.

Una de sus metas es que su negocio prospere, desea tener pronto un pedido y va a hacerlo  bien y con las ganancias quiere darle el dinero necesario para la casa a su esposa, comprar ropa, y espero que el dinero alcance para todos los gastos, Él vive en union libre desde hace 2 años, tiene una niña de 6 meses, la casa en la que vive es de sus padres y su esposa se dedica al hogar.
texts.en:
Eladio lives in the community of “Tres Estrellas” (Three Stars).  This community is slowly advancing as a result of a highway and services, such as schools for the children that will improve education. 

Eladio has a metal shop where he works with aluminum and glass for manufacturing windows and doors.  Eladio wants to invest this loan in the purchase of new equipment and more materials needed to complete his work.  He tells us that "what complicates his business is that there are many establishments that are similar to mine, so there is less work available for me." He hopes that this loan will benefit him so that he can have a better future, generate more work, and provide his family with a better lifestyle.  Since there is more competition, he must complete his work quickly so that he can attract more customers. 

His goals are for his business to prosper, generate more orders soon, and become successful.  With his earnings, Eladio wants to furnish his house with necessary items, and wife to be able to buy clothes.  He hopes to be able to do everything he needs to with his income.  

Eladio has been in a common law marriage for two years.  He has a six month old daughter.  His wife is a homemaker and they live with his parents.

loans.use: To purchase aluminum, glass, and equipment for his metal shop.

loans.name: Delgersaihan

texts.en: Delgersaihan, 22, is married and lives with his wife and son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Ther live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. He began selling clothes out of a rented stall in 2009. His current working capital is 2,500,000 MNT. He wants to expand his business and increase his working capital. He is a hardworking and motivated person who says, " As the spring season comes, people sell their cashmere and their purchasing power increases much more. I want to make more profit and save some money in order to build a house where we can have a comfortable life." He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase more clothes for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita nació en la provincia D. Anta del departamento D. Cusco, ella tiene 52 años D. edad y vive en la ciudad D. Izcuchaca, Anta. 

Margarita se dedica a varias actividades económicas como a la crianza D. animales menores, venta D. artesanía y venta D. ropa. En esta oportunidad Margarita requiere el microcrédito para comprar pollos y para comprar ropa. El sueño D. Margarita es abrir una veterinaria en la ciudad D. Izcuchaca.    

Margarita es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene D. la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Margarita was born in Anta Province, Department of Cusco. She is 52 years old and lives in the city of Izcuchaca, Anta.

Margarita is involved in different business activities such as raising small animals, selling crafts, and selling clothes. She is taking this opportunity to request a microloan to buy chickens and clothing. Her dream is to open a veterinary clinic in the city of Izcuchaca.

Margarita is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The phrase “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” means “Women Who Work” in the Quechua language.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rio Grande Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Río Grande llamado así porque las integrantes viven esta población que lleva el mismo nombre. La población en la que habitan los integrantes es muy hermosa ya que existe variedad de flora y fauna además de que existe un río que atraviesa el poblado. Las 11 personas que integran el grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades y son Aura (venta de productos para la limpieza de autos), Hortencia y María (venta de antojitos), Cirila, Vianey y Sara (venta de productos por catálogos), Herminia (elaboración y venta de tortillas), Ysaura (venta de medicinas naturistas y vajillas), Natividad (venta de artículos para el hogar), Socorro (venta de pescado y refrescos), Hortencia (venta de tamales).
La representante de este grupo es la Señora Hortencia S. A. quien vive en unión libre con el señor Félix Raviera, tiene 5 hijos los cuales estudian la secundaria y primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos como son, tacos, tostadas, enchiladas y sopes, negocio que adquirió hace 14  años debido a la necesidad que tenia ya que en esa apoca su esposo no tenia trabajo y necesitaban dinero es por ello que empezaron con este pequeño negocio. Hortensia solicito el préstamo solicito este préstamo para poder comprar más insumos como son: carnes, verduras, y otros productos que necesita. De las ganancias que obtiene es para el sustento de su familia y para que sus hijos estudien.
Otras de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Socorro una mujer de avanzada edad que a pesar de ello trabaja todos los días para obtener el pan de cada día ya que ella esta sola y tiene que mantener a su nieto que quedo a su cargo desde pequeño, es una mujer admirable que  a pesar de los años y de las diferentes enfermedades que a enfrentado ah sabido salir adelante, actualmente ella sufre de sordera pero eso no es impedimento para seguir adelante y trabajar, ella tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en donde vende pescado y refrescos, ella solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas productos ya que se le esta terminando y no tiene el dinero suficiente para comprar ya que de las ganancias que obtiene es para los gastos de sus casa y los gastos de su nieto para los útiles de la escuela.
Ella lo que pide a dios es que le vida para ver a su nieto crecer y que tenga una buena educación, aunque a su edad pues es muy complicado ya que ella tiene 70 años.
Ella le agradece a dios por la vida y a las personas que le realizaron el préstamo por confiar en personas como ella.
texts.en:
This group is called “Río Grande” because the members live in the town of the same name. The community in which the members live is quite beautiful because of the variety of animal and plant life that exists. In addition, there is a river that runs through the town. There are eleven members in the group who engage in the following activities:

• Aura sells automobile cleaning products. • Hortencia and María sell snacks. • Cirila, Vianey, and Sara sell products through catalogs. • Herminia prepares and sells tortillas. • Ysaura sells natural medicines and dinnerware. • Natividad sells household goods. • Socorro sells fish and soft drinks. • Hortencia sells tamales.

The group representative is Sra. Hortencia S. A.. She is in a common law marriage with Sr. Félix Raviera. They have five children who are either high school or elementary school students. Hortencia sells snacks such as tacos, tostadas, enchiladas, and “sopes” (fried tortillas topped with refried beans, onions, and hot sauce). She started this business fourteen years ago out of necessity because her husband did not have a job and they were in need of money. For this reason, she started a small business. Hortencia is requesting a loan to buy more supplies such as meat, vegetables, and other products that she needs. With her earnings, she is able to sustain her family and provide for her children’s education.

Another member of the group is Sra. Socorro. Even though she is an elderly woman, Socorro works every day to provide for her daily needs. She is single and has a grandson that she has been supporting since he was little. Socorro is an admirable woman who knows how to press forward despite her age and the number of illnesses she has had to endure. She currently suffers from hearing loss, but she does not let this impediment keep her from working and getting ahead. Socorro has a small business in her home where she sells fish and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to buy more products because she is out of inventory and does not have sufficient funds to acquire more. The earnings she generates are used to cover her household expenses and her grandson’s education. She prays to God in hopes that she will see her grandson grow up and have a good education. Socorro knows that this will be difficult since she is 70 years old. She is grateful to God for life and the people who have entrusted individuals like her with these loans.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making snacks.

loans.name: Nela

texts.en:
Nela L. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Nela is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Nela owns & operates a business making & selling food snacks, like chocolate & rice cakes, in the local community. Nela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Nela is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase needed raw ingredients,  like rice, sugar & food seasonings. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like rice, sugar & food seasonings

loans.name: Cotzalzin Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama coatzalzin, decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así es como se llama la colonia donD. viven, esta historia es acerca D. la señora crecencia C. Hernández, ya que es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo, ella tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada con el señor Anselmo clemente, tienen 8 hijos D. los cuales solo trinidad y María Elena, quienes estudian primero D. secundaria y quinto año D. primaria, ya que los demás todos están casados, ella se dedica a la venta D. refrescos, con el cual lleva 3 años.
Dice que eligió esta actividad ya que tenía que buscar la forma D. sacar a sus hijos adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos D. la casa, fue por eso que decidió empezar con este pequeño negocio aparte D. que dice le deja muy buenas ganancias, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra D. mas mercancía como son: mas refrescos, aguas y jugos.
La señora crecencia nos comenta que su propósito es el D. seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para hacerlo crecer mucho mas, ya que quiere poner una tienda D. abarrotes, para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y con ello poder solventar los gastos D. la educación D. sus hijos, ya que quiere que sigan estudiando para que tenga una carrera y una muy buena profesión.
Ella conoce muy bien a sus compañeras y nos comenta que son personas responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante y superarse.
Da las gracias a los prestatarios D. kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.
Las integrantes del grupo cotzalzin y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
Gloria-venta D. pollos, Fortunata-venta D. refrescos, agustina-abarrotes, francisca-venta D. refrescos, Faustina-venta D. pollos, crecencia-venta D. refrescos, nahu-compra D. refacciones, Olivia-dulcería, marina-venta D. pescados y Emilia-venta D. pasta para mole.
texts.en:
This group is called “Coatzalzin”. The members decided on this name because it is also the name of the subdivision in which they live. The story being presented is that of Sra. Crecencia C. Hernández, one of the group members. She is 48 years old, married to Sr. Anselmo Clemente, and has eight children. Trinidad and María Elena are the only children still in school, a first year high school student and a fifth graD. student respectively. The others are married. Crecencia sells soft drinks, which she has been doing for three years.

She chose this business activity because she wanted to find a way to move her children forward and help her husband with the household expenses. For this reason, she decided to start a small business and now she says she generates good earnings. The loan she will receive will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as soft drinks, water, and juices.

Sra. Crecencia says that her plan is to continue investing in her business so that it will grow even more. She wants to establish a grocery store so that she can improve and increase her income to help cover her children’s educational expenses. Crecencia wants them to continue their studies so that they can earn a degree and have a good profession.

She knows the other members very well and says that they are responsible, hardworking, and trustworthy individuals who desire to succeed and improve themselves. She thanks the Kiva lenders for trusting them and giving them this opportunity, but most of all, for believing in them. As a result of this assistance, they will be able to invest in their businesses and have a better future. The members of the Cotzalzin Group and their business activities are as follows:

• Gloria sells chickens. • Fortunata sells soft drinks. • Agustina sells groceries. • Francisca sells soft drinks. • Faustina sells chickens. • Crecencia sells soft drinks. • Nahu sells spare parts. • Olivia has a candy shop. • Marina sells fish. • Emilia sells mole paste.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, water, and juices.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda nació en el departamento de Cusco, ella tiene 38 años de edad y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. 

Hilda es docente y enseña en el colegio de la comunidad de Huayacocha y también se dedica a venta de ropa en el centro comercial “El Paraiso”. En esta oportunidad Margarita requiere el microcrédito para comprar ropa.    

Hilda es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. La palabra “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” proviene de la lengua Quechua que traducido al Castellano significa “Mujeres que Trabajamos”.
texts.en:
Hilda was born in the Department of Cusco. She is 38 years old and lives in the same city where she was born.

Hilda is a teacher at a school in the community of Huayacocha. She also sells clothing at a shopping center called “El Paraiso”. Hilda is taking this opportunity to request a microloan for buying clothes.

Hilda is a responsible person who is a member of the Communal Bank “Warmicuna Llanqanchis”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco, Peru. The phrase “Warmicuna Llanqanchis” means “Women Who Work” in the Quechua language.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida P. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Aida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a specialized retail store selling coconuts for copras in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: 3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Trọng Lê Thị (10) is a 56-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Trọng is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 3 Đông Vệ (08.05.3 Đông Vệ).


Trọng is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Trọng owns and operates a business in the food sector, making & selling food.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Trọng has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Trọng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trọng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Trọng plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Huệ (11) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector, a general store.


2.  T. Thị Cứ (12) is a 63-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector.  T. also runs a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas of the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Trọng  Lê Thị (10) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Trọng  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 3 Đông Vệ (08.05.3 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Trọng  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Trọng  kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Trọng  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Trọng  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Huệ (11) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  T. Thị Cứ (12) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Una Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: La señora Petra pertenece al grupo “UNA NUEVA ESPERANZA” y dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo debido a que gracias a los préstamos que le otorga la financiera ellas tienen una nueva vida ya que así han podido superarse cada una de las integrantes. Doña Petra es una persona muy trabajadora tiene 68 años de edad,  dice que ella ya no estudio porque sus papás no tenían recursos para apoyarla y porque ellos no querían que estudiara porque decían que eso no le iba a dejar nada bueno, entonces ella se puso a trabajar en la ciudad de Zitacuaro, después dice que una vecina le enseño a hacer pan y de ahí empezó con el negocio del pan de rancho y tamales. Doña Petrita como es conocida en su localidad tiene más de 40 años con el negocio del pan comenta que ella va a vender su pan por las casa y a vecés le hacen pedidos. Ella es viuda y vive sola, con el préstamo que esta solicitando comprara leña, harina, azúcar, pasta, bolsa, huevo, leche  para la realización del pan. La meta que tiene para su negocio es hacerse de más clientes darse a conocer en los pueblos grandes. Con las ganancias que saque va a ahorrar para comprar madera y lamina para hacer un techo a fuera de su casa para vender su pan. Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Victoria (comida mexicana, Leticia C. (neveria) y Maria Magdalena (tienda de abarrotes)
texts.en: Petra belongs to the Grupo “Una Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope Group). She says the group was given this name because, thanks to the loans they have been granted by the institution, the life of each member has changed as they have been able to improve themselves. Doña Petra is a very hardworking woman of 68. She says she did not study because her parents did not have money to pay for her education, and also because they did not want her to study because they thought studying would have resulted in nothing good for her. She says that she then started working in the town of Zitacuaro, where a neighbor taught her how to bake bread, and from there she started her activity selling bread and tamales. Doña Petrita is well-known in her town, and she has been engaging in selling bread for more than 40 years. She says she sells her bread door to door, and that sometimes she receives orders. She is a widow and she lives alone. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy firewood and bags, flour, sugar, dough, eggs and milk to prepare bread. She aims at gaining more customers for her activity as well as making herself known in the big cities. She plans on saving the money she will earn, in order to buy wood and sheet steel to add a roof outside her house where to sell her bread. The other members of the group are Victoria (Mexican meals), Leticia C. (frozen food) and Maria Magdalena (general store).

loans.use: To buy ingredients and tools to prepare bread, like firewood, flour and sugar.

loans.name: San Jose La Parotas Group

texts.es:
Grupo San José las Parotas denominado así por el punto de reunión de las personas que integran el grupo existen dos árboles grandes llamadas parotas y es por ello que decidieron ponerle así. Son 11 personas las que integran este grupo dedicadas a su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida cada día. Es una población muy hermosa un lugar donde existe una procesadora de limones ya que en esta comunidad se da mucho de estos productos.
R. B. E. es la representante del grupo. Vive en unión libre con el señor Isidro López quien tiene un equipo de sonido. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian la primaria y el kinder. R. solicito el préstamo poder comprar calzados ya que tiene un pedido muy grande y no le alcanza el dinero para comprar toda la mercancía, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo. Además también se dedica a las manualidades hace diferentes tipos de recuerdos para cualquier ocasión como boda, bautizo, 15 años, etc. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza cualquier tipo de actividad con tal de obtener ganancia para mantener a su familia. Ella sueña con engrandecer su negocio poner un local en donde pueda vender sus productos.
El señor Mario es uno de los integrantes de este grupo el vive en unión libre con la señora Gudelia Ruiz quien se dedica al hogar, tiene 4 hijos los cuales 3 están casados y 1 estudia. Mario de dedica a la compra y venta de coco (fruta comestible que se obtiene de la palmera),  sus ventas los realiza en su comunidad y en los poblados cercanos los vende de mayoreo y menudeo. El tiene varios años realizando esta actividad, anteriormente se dedicaba a las labores del campo, con sus ventas que realiza ah podido mantener a su familia, son muy humildes pero buenas personas trabajando para asi obtener el pan de cada día. Lo que mas desea es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
Las personas que integran este grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades y son las siguientes:
Francisco y Nicolás (Compra y venta de agua purificada)
Mario (Compra y venta de cocos)
Romualda y Aurora (Compra y venta de ropa)
Catalina y Asunción (Venta de abarrotes)
Belén y Julia (Venta de perfumes y cosméticos)
R. (Venta de zapatos por catalogo)
Epigmenia (Venta de antojitos)
texts.en:
San José las Parotas group is named for their meeting spot. There are two big trees called "parotas" and they named their group after them. There are 11 people in this group who are dedicated to working to achieve a better quality of life. They live in a beautiful place where there exists a lemon processor because these products are very important in this community.

R. B. E. is the group representative. She lives in a common law marriage with Isidro López, who has a sound team. She has 3 children in primary school and kindergarten. R. is requesting this loan to be able to buy footwear because she has a large order and doesn't have enough money to buy the merchandise. She sells shoes by catalog. She also makes handicrafts and different types of mementos for whatever occasion, such as weddings, baptisms, quinceañeras, etc. She's a hardworking woman who does any type of activity to maintain her family. She dreams of growing her business and starting a shop where she can sell her products.

Mario is one of the members of this group. He lives in a common law marriage with Gudelia Ruiz, a housewife. He has 4 children, 3 of whom are married and one is in school. Mario buys and sells coconuts (fruit of the palm tree). He makes his sales in the community and nearby towns. He sells wholesale and retail. He's had this job for several years. Previously he had worked on the land. With his sales he's able to support his family. They're humble but good people who work hard for their daily bread. What he wants most is for his children to study and have a better quality of life.

The members of this group have various jobs. They are as follows:
