Francisco y Nicolás (buying and selling of purified water); Mario (buying and selling of coconuts) Romualda y Aurora (buying and selling of clothing) Catalina y Asunción (grocery sales) Belén y Julia (perfume and cosmetics sales) R. (catalog shoe sales) Epigmenia (snack sales)

loans.use: to buy shoes from a catalog for sale

loans.name: 4 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
"Tuyết  T. Thị (13) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Tuyết is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 4 Đông Vệ (08.05.4 Đông Vệ ).


Tuyết  is married and has one school-aged child.  To making a living, Tuyết  owns & operates a general store selling  products for daily use, such as shampoo, soap, & toothpaste.  Tuyết  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Tuyết  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tuyết  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tuyết  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  T. Thị K. Khánh (14) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  Lê Thị N. Linh (15) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tuyết  T. Thị (13) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Tuyết  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 4 Đông Vệ (08.05.4 Đông Vệ ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tuyết  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tuyết  kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Tuyết  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tuyết  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  T. Thị K. Khánh (14) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  Lê Thị N. Linh (15) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: La Abundancia Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad llamada El refugio hay un ingenio azucarero el cual proporciona mas del 50% D. los empleos D. esta comunidad. En este este pueblo existe un grupo llamado L. Abundacia porque viven en una region que produce mucha azucar .

Silvia es uno D. los miembros D. este grupo, elL. tiene 20 años , estudio solo L. preparatoria en unos meses sera madre soltera, asi que elL. a decidido iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio D. vanta D. comida corrida, antojitos mexicanos(Chiles rellenos, tamales, empanadas, gorditas, tacos y tortas) y pizza, elL. venD. casa por casa con sus amigos y vecionos D. L. comunidad.

ElL. espera que con esta inversion sus ventas suban ya que nos platica que tiene un local en su casa en el cual  en un futuro le gustaria instalar su negocio.

Doña CiriL. es otro intrante del grupo L. abundancia, elL. tiene L. edad D. 56 años y nos platica que hace mas D. un año inicio con su negocio D. venta D. comida ya que el dinero que su esposo gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar

Doña CiriL. trabaja poniendo lonche a algunos jornaleros D. su comunidad y nos comenta que en un futuro le gustaria poner una pequeña fondita para desD. ahi vender su comida ya no solo los trabajadores sino a todas las personas que desean, tambien le gustaria invertir un poco en dulces.

Ellas necesitan este credito para invertirlo en L. compra D. insumos (col, tomates, chiles, cebolL., frijol, carne, crema, queso, tortillas, maiz, huevos, Arroz, platanos, papas, aceite y gas) para posteriormente elaborar sus alimentos y venderlos

Los demas intrgrantes son:Jose Domingo, Guadalupe, AdeL., Alejandro, Albina, Ceferina, Maria Alba, Patricia (Paty, como L. llaman).
Ellos dicen: "Gracias a FRAC y a KIVA por creer en nosotros y ayudarnos a mejorar nuestros negocios y vidas"
texts.en:
There is a sugar refinery in the community of El Refugio that provides more than 50% of jobs in the community.  In this village there is a group called 'L. Abundancia' (Abundance).  They chose this name because they live in a region that produces a lot of sugar.

20 year-old Silvia is one of the members of this group.  Silvia has only an elementary school level of education and in a few months time she will become a single mother.  For this reason, she decided to start working in her own business selling fast food, Mexican snacks (stuffed chilis, tamales, empanadas, stuffed corn cakes, tacos and sandwiches) and pizza.  She makes her sales door to door to her friends and neighbors.

Silvia hopes that this investment will increase her sales because she tells us that she has premises in her home in which, in the future, she would like to set up her business.

CiriL. is another member of the 'L. Abundancia' group.  She is 56 years old and tells us that she started her business selling meals more than a year ago because her husband's earnings didn't stretch far enough to cover all their household expenses.

Cirilia provides lunches to some of the day laborers in her community and she tells us that in the future she would like to set up a small inn where she could sell her meals not only to the workers but also to anybody else who would like to eat there.  She would also like to invest a little in making sweet treats.

The members of this group need a loan to invest in buying supplies (cabbage, tomatoes, chilis, onions, beans, meat, cream, cheese, tortillas, corn, eggs, rice, bananas, potatoes, oil and gas) with which to make their meals that they will then sell.

The other members of this group are: Jose Domingo, Guadalupe, AdeL., Alejandro, Albina, Ceferina, Maria Alba and Patricia (who everyone calls Paty).  They say "Thank you to FRAC and KIVA for believing in us and helping us to improve our businesses and lives).

loans.use: to buy handicrafts, supplies for making snacks and clothes

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita G. is from the village of Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old. Carmelita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling used clothing, or ukay-ukay, in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional used clothing. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like used clothing

loans.name: Jurial

texts.en:
Jurial G. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 43 years old. Jurial is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Jurial owns & operates a business providing motorela, or habal-habal, services to local community members. Jurial has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jurial joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jurial is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jurial from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Lilia D. is from the village of Panghiawan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old. Lilia is married and has one young child. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap, & candies in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Evelyn is separated from her spouse and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a specialized store selling seafood products such as flying fish & milk fish. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to purchase additional fish & working capital. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish, like milk fish, mackerel & sardines. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like milk fish, mackerel & sardines

loans.name: Enhbaigalmaa

texts.en: Enhbaigalmaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, age 46, works as a guard for a private company. Her oldest son and daughter go to college while the youngest helps with the family business. Enhbaigalmaa operates a clothing sewing business in her town. She started her business in a rented booth in 2007, with working capital of 80,000 MNT. Now her working capital exceeds 400,000 MNT. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and open-minded person who says, " I want to own my working place in the future." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials.

loans.name: Por

texts.en:
Four people are forming this group loan. Mrs. Por was born in 1962,  and is a village bank leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members.  Each member of this group will use her money to support her own purpose.

Mrs. Por is a widow with four children.  One is a farm laborer and the other three are students and also help their mother in her businesses. 

Mrs. Por earns her living by knitting. Currently her business is not earning enough income to support her family. Thus, in order to increase income to improve her family's condition, she would like a loan to buy pig food and piglets for breeding, .

loans.use: to buy piglets for breeding, and pig food.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 61 years old and married with five children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Nilda aspires to save for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jaime Ramel

texts.en:
Jaime Ramel D. P. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 42 years old and married.  Jaime Ramel owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, biscuits & candies. loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 59 years old and lives with her mother, who is 89, in a ger,  a Mongolian traditional housing tent.  They live in Arhangai province of Mongolia. Oyun's children are grown and live by themselves. 

She manages a clothes-trading business out of a rented stall in a local market. She started her business in 2007 with working capital of 200,000 MNT. Her business was quite successful, which enabled her to expand her business with 800,000 MNT.  This has allowed her to contribute to the family's living. 

Oyun is a very honest woman with good communication skills. She wants to continue her business and says "I would like to have my own working place in the future." She is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
El señor D. V. ROBERTO CARLOS es un cliente de  con 35 años, es profesional en el área del Derecho, vive en una vivienda alquilada,  tiene su vivienda en calidad de inquilino en la zona sudoeste de la ciudad en la  provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor D. V. ROBERTO CARLOS, presta sus servicios en un bufete de abogados, donde atienden principalmente a personas de escasos recursos económicos y principalmente personas del área rural del departamento de Cochabamba.  

La vivienda en que habita el señor Roberto Carlos es modesta,  cuenta con los servicios básicos completos. 
El señor Roberto Carlos solicita el crédito destinado para la realización de sus trámites en la obtención de titulo en provisión nacional en la rama de abogacía, y de esta manera poder trabajar y apoyar directamente a personas con escasos recursos económicos, así también mejorar sus condiciones de vida con una profesión estable.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Carlos D. V. is 35 years old.  He is a Lawyer.  He lives in a rented house in the southwest part of the city in Cercado Province, Cochabamba Department.  His house is modest but has all basic utilities.

He works in a law office whose clients are primarily low-income people from the rural parts of Cochabamba. Roberto Carlos is asking for a loan to pay for the paperwork involved in recognizing his law degree in ‘provisión nacional’ (people who get their degrees from private universities) so that he can work and directly help low-income people as well as improve his living conditions through the exercise of a stable profession.

loans.use: to pay for the paperwork involved with his Law degree.

Franie Mamasig, S.. is from the village of Sinamar in the Philippines. He is 42 years old. Franie is married and has two school-aged children. About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en:
Delgermaa, 28, is married and lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a 'ger', a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband currently works in Korea with the contract of labor force exchange between two countries. Delgermaa's elder daughter attends a local secondary school. 

Delgermaa began retail trading of textiles and clothes in 2003. Now she rents a stall at a trading center and sells clothes, textiles and children's clothing. She always tries to sell good quality items so that she attracts many customers. She is a hard-working and initiative person who says, "My business is becoming more stable now. I want to expand my business and start manufacturing children's clothes with good quality materials." She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes and textiles from Russia for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and textiles from Russia.

texts.en:

In addition, she also raises a few pigs in a pigpen behind her house for additional income to help support the whole family. Pal U.’s husband is a good cook who provides a cooking service for ceremonies and wedding parties. He can make around $1.50 in profit per day from his occupation.  They have four children, and one of their daughters is employed in a garment factory. 

Pal U. will use her loan to buy a used motorbike to pick up her fish and also  for other traveling needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to pick up her fish and for other trips.

Thus, in order to improve the family's condition, Mrs. Phon would like to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding to start a new business.  With the rest of the loan, she will buy a fishing boat for her husband.  Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of the four borrowers who are shown in the picture. The group's leader, Han H., is 50 years old.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is local fisherman. Han H. and her husband make a living by selling fish which they catch in and around the Tunle Sap River. They typically generate approximately $7 a day in income to support their family. 

Recently, this family was not able to catch as many fish as before because their boat often broke down. Therefore, Han H. is applying for a loan to repair their old boat and to buy a new piece of fishing equipment for the boat.  This loan will help her family can catch more fish, as they did before. 

The other three borrowers in this group include: 

Mrs. T., who will be using her loan to buy some nets to support her fishing activities.
Mrs. T., who is applying for a loan to purchase nets to catch more fish.
Mrs. P., who is asking for a loan to buy new machine equipment for her boat for fishing purposes.

loans.use: To repair her old boat and buy new fishing equipment

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:

Basilisa requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit cookstove because she wants to save money by using the dried wood from her surroundings.

Basilisa is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of an envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul S., 33, is the leader of this group.  She resides in Kochkor. She is married to a general worker and together they take care of five children, the oldest of whom is fifteen. For five years Jazgul has been selling women clothing.  During the warm seasons she also runs a second business selling vegetables.   Both businesses generate between 6,000 and 10,000 soms a month.   She plans to use this loan to invest in both her vegetable selling and her clothing retail business.

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits/vegetables and clothing to resell

Thus, Mrs. Lun would like to ask for a loan to buy a water pump and fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah G. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Leah is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Leah owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling delicacies such as flavored ices or halo-halo in the local community. She also sells ready-to-wear clothing & electronic cell phone loads. Leah has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional ingredients & fund working capital for her business. 

Leah is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make halo-halo, such as sugar and milk. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make ices to sell

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen K. is 26 years old.  She lives in the province of Siem Reap and earns a living by selling ice blocks. Yen K. is married to Tim Sarith, age 25, who helps her in the same business. They are blessed with four children, three of whom are attending school while one is still too young.

Yen K. is having financial difficulty with rebuilding her old house.   She is lacking the funds needed to continue with the building process. Yen K. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy additional timber planks to continue building her house.

loans.use: buy the timber needed to finish rebuilding her house

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida N. is from the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Aida is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a motorcycle transport or habal-habal service.  Her husband is the driver in the r business, which provides transport services to local community members. Aida has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. 

Aida is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tools and supplies needed to maintain service. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase the tools and supplies needed to maintain her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila M. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 41 years old. Laila is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Laila owns & operates a business selling rice and corn grains in the local community. Laila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Laila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & fund working capital for her business. 

Laila is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of rice and corn. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice & corn

loans.name: Dariyka's Group

texts.en:
Dariyka S., 43, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in Kochkor and together with her husband, a tractor driver, brings up four children.  Their oldest child is getting ready to graduate from high school. 

Dariyka’s husband is currently repairing his tractor and is getting ready for field work. In the winter, he breeds and sells livestock and Dariyka helps him take care of them.  Currently, the couple is finishing the construction of their house using the revenue from their business.  They plan to spend part of this loan on purchasing the fuel needed for the sowing process, and part of it on purchasing sheep or bulls for their livestock business. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fuel

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun was born in 1967.  She is a mother of six children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, one is a barber, three are studying in the local public school, and the youngest one is 4 years old.  She and her husband, Mr. Bou, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to feed themselves.  Mr. Bou is a construction worker and a basket maker. 

Although they try to work hard, they can earn only a small income.  To improve their condition, Mrs. Yoeun is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch was born in 1980.  She is married woman to Mr. Phorn, who was born in 1974. This couple has six children: one is a cloth seller who has a salary, three are attending the public local schools, and the others are still too young to study or work. 

Mrs. Touch stays at home and cooks for her family. Her husband is a construction foreman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. In order to improve his construction business, Mrs. Touch would like to ask for a loan to buy more construction supplies for her husband's use.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Horng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eight people who have been selected Mrs. Horng to be their village bank president. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living.

Mrs. Horng was born in 1948. She and her husband, Mr. C., are farmers who own a small piece of land where they grow rice to feed their family.  Mrs. Horng wants to buy a lot of rice at this time because rice is currently cheap.  To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy more rice for eating. 

This couple has three children, two of whom are employed in garment factories, and the other is studying in a local public school.

loans.use: To buy rice to eat

loans.name: Hâm

texts.en:
Hâm P., age 51, is a local farmer in Kompong Cham province. Her husband works as a motor taxi driver.  Together they earn 3.50 dollars per day to use for the family’s needs.  Besides her farming business, Hâm P. also sells vegetables to earn extra income.  The most imporant factor in their success is that this couple always pay attention in their work and are also very friendly. 

Hâm P. has four children, the oldest is married.   Two of their children are factory workers who receive wages of 80 dollars per month.  Hâm P. used this loan for US$800 to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables to sell, and by buying a trailer to connect to her motorcycle to pick up items to sell in the local market.  She hopes this loan will make their living easier than before. 

Hâm P. and her young child are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell and to buy a trailer to transport her products to the market.

loans.name: Mrs. Poch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people are making up this village bank loan.  They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living.   Mrs. Poch was selected by the other members to be the village bank president.  

Mrs. Poch was born in 1975.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to feed her family.  Her husband, Mr. Sok Hak, is a truck driver who receives a small salary to support his family.  

In order to improve her family living, Mrs. Poch wants to start a new business.  To achieve this purpose, she is applying for a loan to buy some piglets to breed.  With the rest of the loan she will install sewers for use in her home. 

Mrs. Poch is a mother of four children, one of whom works as a driver, and the others are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Samen's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members who have selected Mrs. Samen to be their group leader.  The members of this group loan will use their portion of the loan for their  different purposes in order to improve their families' livI..  

Mrs. Samen was born in 1981. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell as well as to eat.  Mrs. Samen has free time outside her farmI. work so she wants to start a new business.  To achieve this purpose, she is applyI. for a loan to buy piglets for breedI. and pig food to start her new business. Her husband, Mr. Rot Nak, is a construction worker. Through these activities, they support two children, one of whom is a student, and the youngest one is 7 years old.

loans.use: buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Jyldyz's Group

texts.en:
Jyldyz S., 39, is the treasurer of this group. She resides in Kochkor village, is married and has three young children. Her husband is a member of the local farmers’ community and since 1994 they have both been involved in farming and cattle breeding. The main challenge for Jyldyz is to devote the needed attention to both her children and her business. The couple enriched the family assets with a purchase of cattle for their farm. Jyldyz plans to spend this loan on purchasing more cattle for breeding and reselling.  

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
